0.title: Wimbledon bans Russian and Belarusian players from 2022 edition
0.article_body: Wimbledon banned Russian and Belarusian players from participating in the 2022 edition. "In...circumstances of such unjustified...military aggression, it'd be unacceptable for Russian regime to derive any benefits from...involvement of Russian or Belarusian players with [Wimbledon]," organisers said. "If circumstances change materially [by] June, we'll consider & respond accordingly," they added.

1.title: Brazil, Argentina to play friendly at Melbourne's MCG in June
1.article_body: The Victorian state government on Wednesday said Brazil and Argentina will play a friendly match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on June 11. "Our expectation, based on the discussions we've had, is that players like [Lionel] Messi and Neymar will be here," the state's Sports Minister Martin Pakula said. Brazil and Argentina last played at the MCG in 2017.

2.title: Truck carrying cattle seized in Assam; 5 people arrested
2.article_body: The Assam Police has rescued 35 cattle and have arrested five persons on the charges of animal cruelty in Biswanath, Assam. A team of Biswanath police station reportedly intercepted a truck from the Biswanath area, based on secret information. "We have apprehended five persons and a case has been registered in connection with it," Navin Singh, Superintendent of Police, said.

3.title: Play with Ukrainian children to make them feel welcome: Norway PM to kids
3.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store has urged the country's children to invite Ukrainian children, who've fled their country amid Russian invasion, to play with them and make them feel welcome. "If you...[play] chess or football, invite them to join you," Store told a news briefing for media dedicated to children. About 14,000 Ukrainians have so far sought refuge in Norway.

4.title: 4 planets to align this week, to be visible with naked eye
4.article_body: Four planets, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn, will align this week. Experts said the best viewing window is between 5 am and 6 am in the coming days. NASA had revealed that at the beginning of April, Mars, Venus and Saturn had formed a trio and now, the three planets have been joined by Jupiter.

5.title: Was crying as I hugged him: Ram on working with father in 'Acharya'
5.article_body: Ram Charan, speaking about working with his father Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', has said, "Dad and I used to eat dinner together...then get up the next day to start working out together." While working together, Chiranjeevi reportedly told Charan that they'll be unable to relive these moments. To this, Ram said, "I was baffled. I was crying as I hugged him."

6.title: Germany rejects Russia's demand to pay for natural gas in rubles
6.article_body: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said companies buying Russian natural gas shouldn't have to set up ruble accounts to pay for it. "Contracts are based on dollars and euros and so private-sector companies should pay in dollars or euros," Lindner said. Last month, Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles.

7.title: BJP has made bulldozer a symbol of its illegal power: Akhilesh Yadav
7.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP has made bulldozers a symbol of its illegal power. "Muslims and other minorities, backward and Dalits are on their target. Now even Hindus are becoming victims of their hysteria. The BJP is actually running this bulldozer on the Constitution itself," Akhilesh added.

8.title: Netflix shares crash over 35% in their biggest fall in more than 10 years
8.article_body: Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. The stock crashed after Netflix reported losing 2,00,000 customers in Q1 2022, marking the first time in more than 10 years that the company lost subscribers. At the time of writing, Netflix shares were trading at $224.68, shedding nearly a third of their value.

9.title: FIR filed against groom 1 day after Hindu outfit stops marriage in UP
9.article_body: A day after members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini forcibly stopped an inter-faith marriage in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, police on Tuesday filed an FIR against the groom for allegedly kidnapping the bride from Ludhiana. We informed Ludhiana police as the couple belonged to different religions and the woman's family had lodged a missing complaint, Moradabad Deputy SP Sagar Jain said.

10.title: Tharoor shares meaning of word 'quockerwodger', says 'useful addition to vocabulary'
10.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared the meaning of the word 'quockerwodger'. "A useful addition to our political vocabulary," he wrote with the meaning. "In politics, a quockerwodger was a politician acting on the instructions of an influential third party, rather than properly representing their constituents," the meaning stated.

11.title: Take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco: Goa BJP leader to PM
11.article_body: Goa BJP leader Shekhar Salkar has requested PM Narendra Modi to take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco products. "I have no words to condemn the way Akshay Kumar has joined the gang of Amitabh Bachchan, Shahrukh Khan, Ajay Devgn to promote cancer through a surrogate advertisement of tobacco product," he said. He added these actors should be ashamed.

12.title: Haven't consciously stayed away from Bollywood: Nimrat Kaur
12.article_body: Nimrat Kaur said she has not stayed away from Bollywood consciously. "I genuinely wanted to work on more projects," she added. Nimrat said that she went to shoot for an American TV show 'Wayward Pines' after completing the 2016 film 'Airlift'. After 'Airlift', Nimrat starred in 'Dasvi'. In 2017, she featured in the Hindi web series 'The Test Case'.

13.title: Delhi sees over 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, 60% jump in single day
13.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,009 fresh cases of COVID-19, which is around 60% higher than 632 cases the city recorded on Tuesday. One person died of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate rose to 5.70% from 4.42%. The number of active cases in the national capital jumped to 2,641 from 1,274 on Tuesday.

14.title: Tata Steel to stop business with Russia over Ukraine invasion
14.article_body: Tata Steel has taken a "conscious" decision to stop doing business with Russia, the steel major said on Wednesday amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It stated, "Tata Steel doesn't have any operations or employees in Russia." All of the company's manufacturing sites in India, the UK and the Netherlands have sourced alternative supplies of raw materials, it added.

15.title: Biliti to set up world's largest electric 3-wheeler plant in T'gana
15.article_body: US-based Biliti Electric will invest $150 million to set up the world's largest electric three-wheeler production facility in Telangana, the company said in a statement. The facility, set up over a 200-acre area, will have a production capacity of 2,40,000 vehicles/year. The facility's first phase, with production capacity of 18,000 vehicles/year, is expected to be operational in early 2023.

16.title: Adani to invest ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal, to create 25,000 jobs
16.article_body: Adani Group Chairman and Founder Gautam Adani has announced that the company will invest around ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal in the next few years. "This will provide direct and indirect employment to around 25,000 people," Adani stated. He added that the investment will be made in sectors like under-sea cable, data centre and warehouses.

17.title: Bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not Arjun; punishment for Muslims: Owaisi
17.article_body: President of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not on Arjun, adding that "collective punishment" is being given to Muslims. He also asked why only shops in front of the mosques were demolished and not ones in front of the temples. "This is a targeted demolition," Owaisi added.

18.title: Butterfly-shaped house with no walls goes on sale for ₹52cr in Greece; pics surface
18.article_body: A house designed in the shape of a butterfly is up for sale on the coastline of Greece for £5.2 million (around ₹52 crore). The 5,381-sqft house has no walls and is said to have four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and an indoor pool among other luxury amenities. Viewed from above, the house emulates two wings and body of a butterfly.

19.title: Treat Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, with care: UK PM to Russia
19.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson urged Russia to treat a Briton, who was captured in Ukraine, humanely and compassionately. PM Johnson said, "I understand that he had been serving in the Ukrainian forces for some time and his situation was very different from that of a mercenary." "I hope that he's treated with care and compassion," the UK PM added.

20.title: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Delhi Files' faces objection from Sikh group, director reacts
20.article_body: Filmmakers should "desist from disturbing...uneasy calm in society", the Maharashtra Sikh Association said after Vivek Agnihotri announced his next movie 'The Delhi Files'. "I'm an Indian, I live in a sovereign state...I'll make what I need to make...I'm not a servant to anybody's demands," Agnihotri said. There has been speculation that 1984 anti-Sikh riots will feature in the film.

21.title: Microsoft India to help SaaS startups build core AI models
21.article_body: Microsoft on Wednesday announced two new initiatives to "strengthen" support for startups in India. As per the announcement, Microsoft AI Innovate will introduce its second cohort, which will let SaaS (Software as a Service) startups partner with Microsoft's engineering and product teams to build their core AI models. A hackathon aiming to create digital solutions will also be organised.

22.title: Nissan to discontinue Datsun brand in India
22.article_body: Nissan is discontinuing Datsun brand in India, the company said on Wednesday. India was one of the last markets where Datsun was still operational after its global relaunch failed and it was discontinued in Russia and Indonesia in 2020. "Datsun redi-GO production has ceased at the Chennai plant...sales of the model still continue (till the stock lasts)," Nissan India said.

23.title: India to provide additional $500 million to Sri Lanka to buy fuel
23.article_body: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister GL Peiris on Wednesday said India will provide an additional $500 million in financial assistance to the country for it to buy fuel. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, taking the total supply of various types of fuels under Indian assistance to Sri Lanka to 2,70,000 MT.

24.title: Bulldoze BJP HQ to stop hooliganism in country: Manish Sisodia
24.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that the BJP headquarters should be bulldozed to stop hooliganism in the country. "The illegal constructions have been demolished, now the homes of those BJP netas should be demolished who gave protection to them," Sisodia said. BJP has only encouraged fighting and has done nothing for schools and hospitals, he added.

25.title: Target not breached 'so badly': FM on 17-month-high inflation
25.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India hasn't breached the inflation target "so badly". Her statement came after India's retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of about 6.95% in March against 6.07% in February. "Our tolerance band is just 4%, plus or minus 2%...So we might go as much as 6%," she stated during her US visit.

26.title: UK PM Johnson to begin 2-day India visit tomorrow, to meet PM Modi
26.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is scheduled to begin his two-day visit to India tomorrow. He will visit Gujarat on April 21 and hold consultations with PM Narendra Modi on April 22. On Sunday, Boris had said, "My visit to India will deliver on...things that...matter to the people of both...nations...from job creation and economic growth to energy security and defence."

27.title: Bomb blast hits crowded restaurant in Nigeria; 3 killed, 19 injured
27.article_body: At least three people were killed and 19 others injured in a blast in east Nigeria's Taraba state on Tuesday, reports stated. The incident reportedly took place at a crowded restaurant located in Irawe town of Taraba, a police spokesperson was quoted as saying. "It's suspected to have been caused by an improvised explosive device that detonated," the spokesperson added.

28.title: DC to bowl first against PBKS, Sarfaraz Khan replaces COVID-19 +ve Mitchell Marsh
28.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have made one change to their playing XI, with Sarfaraz Khan replacing Mitchell Marsh, who recently tested positive for COVID-19. Meanwhile, Nathan Ellis replaced Odean Smith in PBKS' playing XI.

29.title: Farah shares old pic of Abhishek, Hrithik from her sangeet; fans react
29.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan shared an old picture of actors Abhishek Bachchan and Hrithik Roshan from her sangeet function on Instagram. "Found an almost vintage pic of these two boys...Abhishek and Hrithik dancing up a storm. Can't remember to which song. I was too drunk," Farah captioned the post. "One of the best duos, best cop and thief," a user commented.

30.title: Did 80 shows in 2019, missed playing live during pandemic: Prateek Kuhad
30.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad has revealed that he did around 80 live shows while touring in 2019. "I was exhausted by the end of 2019...I did feel a sense of relief [when the lockdown happened] because I didn't have to play shows," he stated. Prateek added that he started missing the stage and playing live after a year into the pandemic.

31.title: Gang of fake Microsoft workers busted in Gurugram, 3 women among 14 held
31.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday busted a gang of fake Microsoft workers and arrested 14 people, including three women, for cheating US nationals by sending pop-ups on their computer screens. The police raided the call centre in Gurugram and seized 14 laptops, nine mobile phones and over ₹1.10 lakh in cash, reports said.

32.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi's Ghazipur landfill site for 3rd time since Mar 28
32.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in east Delhi on Wednesday, nearly 10 days after a massive fire broke out at the same site. A total of nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to bring the blaze under control. This is the third fire incident at the landfill site since March 28.

33.title: Did a line or two of cocaine with Amber Heard's sister, admits Johnny Depp in court
33.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp, during a defamation trial, admitted to doing "a line or two" of cocaine with his ex-wife Amber Heard's sister, Whitney. He said Heard's allegations of substance abuse have been "grossly embellished" and that there have been no moments where he's been out of control. "I'm not some maniac who needs to be high...all the time," Depp stated.

34.title: Don't think this is COVID 4th wave: Ex-ICMR scientist as cases rise
34.article_body: Former head scientist at ICMR, Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar, on Wednesday said he doesn't think that a fourth wave of COVID-19 has emerged in the country. "No new variant has emerged so far," he said. He added that those who are older and people who haven't taken vaccines need to remember to use a face mask.

35.title: People have lost faith in WB police: BJP's Anirban Ganguly
35.article_body: Amid political violence in West Bengal, BJP's Anirban Ganguly has said that the people of West Bengal have lost faith in the state police. Demanding CBI investigation in the recent rape cases, he said, "The SIT is never successful in the investigations because TMC is pressurising them to not do the investigation properly."

36.title: Gujarat Police registered 12,500 cyber crime complaints in March
36.article_body: Gujarat Police's cybercrime cell received around 12,500 complaints related to financial fraud, stalking or bullying and other cybercrimes in March. "Among the 12,488 complaints registered in March this year, around 3,338 were recognised as financial frauds to the tune of ₹3.09 crore," a statement said. The cell also froze ₹1.20 crore in bank accounts and refunded ₹51.12 lakh.

37.title: Man who shot Khargone SP during riots identified: MP Home Minister
37.article_body: The man who fired a bullet at Khargone SP Siddharth Choudhary during the riots on Ram Navami on April 10 has been identified and will be arrested soon, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. "Those who indulged in the stone-pelting during the communal violence are being identified through video footage," Narottam Mishra added.

38.title: Delhi man's juice shop bulldozed, video shows him saying 'I had all papers'
38.article_body: A juice shop of a man named Ganesh Kumar Gupta was bulldozed in a demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday. In a video, the man can be heard saying, "I...said that Supreme Court has halted the demolition one hour ago, but they did not stop." He added, "I told them I have all...papers. But they didn't listen."

39.title: 'Article 15' is the only dark film I've done, it affected me: Ayushmann
39.article_body: After completing 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that 'Article 15' was the film that really affected him. "That's the only dark film I've done. The theme was very dark," he stated. "I had read a lot about BR Ambedkar and also casteism...that affected me," he further added. The film was directed by Anubhav Sinha.

40.title: Israel announces end to indoor mask-mandate for 2nd time
40.article_body: Israel on Wednesday said for the second-time that citizens no longer have to wear masks indoors, after briefly dropping the requirement for two weeks last June before cases surged. A government statement said the mask mandate will be removed from Saturday after approval from a parliamentary oversight committee. Israel's health ministry said about 64% of the population are considered vaccinated.

41.title: Durban floods kill at least 448 as $67 million allocated in relief
41.article_body: South Africa has allocated $67 million in relief for those affected by the floods in Durban, and the surrounding KwaZulu-Natal province, that have killed at least 448 people so far. Officials on Tuesday said over 40,000 people have been displaced as nearly 4,000 homes have been destroyed while over 40 people remain missing.

42.title: Wearing of face masks indoors no longer obligatory: Spanish govt
42.article_body: The Spanish government on Tuesday said wearing face masks indoors is no longer obligatory. However, masks remain mandatory on all forms of public transport but not in stations and airports. Over 92% of the population aged 12 and older is fully vaccinated. Masks became mandatory for use indoors and outdoors in Spain in early 2020.

43.title: Covid-19 situation in Maharashtra is under control: Rajesh Tope
43.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that the Covid-19 situation in the state is under control and people need not panic. "Yesterday, there were 137 cases in Maharashtra, including 85 in Mumbai. The state had earlier seen 60,000 cases a day. So, the present situation is under control and there is no need to panic," Tope said.

44.title: Ban RSS, Bajrang Dal and VHP along with PFI: K'taka Cong leader
44.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader MB Patil called for a ban on RSS, Bajrang Dal, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), along with Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI). "Ban AIMIM also, we don't have any reservations, let it get cleared at once, by doing so showcase your (BJP-led government's) strong will...Congress party will fully support," Patil said.

45.title: Vivek Agnihotri's Kashmir Files to release in Israel on April 28
45.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files', which was directed by Vivek Agnihotri, will release in Israel on April 28 with Hebrew subtitles. "I thank Consul General Kobbi Shoshani for coming to our studio to inaugurate the poster of 'The Kashmir Files'," Vivek tweeted. "It is a major step in sharing our [common] goal of fighting terrorism and promoting humanity," he added.

46.title: No 4th wave of Covid-19 in the state now: K'taka health minister
46.article_body: Amid concerns of another possible wave of Covid-19, Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said that Karnataka is not facing the fourth wave of Covid-19 now. He ensured that the government was taking all the precautionary measures and monitoring rise in cases. "We are in contact with other states as well and are gathering all the required information," he said.

47.title: Hyd Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹1.2 lakh
47.article_body: Members of the Commissioner's Task Force, South Zone Team and Hyderabad's Falaknuma Police busted a cricket betting racket on Tuesday and seized cash worth ₹1.2 lakh and two mobile phones. The accused were allegedly betting on the IPL match between Royal Challengers Bangalore and Lucknow Super Giants when the police apprehended them. The prime accused is a native of Falaknuma.

48.title: Pics of Johnny Depp's injuries allegedly caused by Amber Heard shown in court
48.article_body: Johnny Depp's personal security guard, Sean Bett, shared pictures of the injured actor during the ongoing defamation trial between Depp and his ex-wife Amber Heard. Sean said he took the photos as "evidence", claiming to have been present after two attacks by Heard. He said the first incident happened in March 2015 and the second incident was in December 2015.

49.title: Demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri wasn't confined to rioters: Mayor
49.article_body: The demolition of alleged illegal encroachments in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Wednesday wasn't confined to those accused of riots during a Hanuman Jayanti rally last week, North Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh has said. He added that it is routine work with no agenda. "The roads will be cleared and people are happy...people are supporting us," he added.

50.title: 'World's loneliest house' on a deserted island goes on sale for ₹2.5cr in US; pic viral
50.article_body: A house dubbed as the 'world's loneliest home' on a deserted island in the US' Maine has gone up for sale for around $339,000 (around ₹2.5 crore). Built in 2009, the 540-sqft house has just one bedroom, one bathroom and an outhouse on the porch. It is located on Duck Ledges Island.

51.title: Electricity dept employee kicked on chest over power cut in Hyd, video viral
51.article_body: A sub-engineer of the electricity department in Hyderabad's Karwan section office was kicked on his chest by a man after electricity supply to his office was cut over long pending issues, police said. A video that has gone viral on social media shows the 22-year-old man thrashing the junior engineer at his office. Other people tried to stop the man.

52.title: Work to destroy peace in state has begun: Maha Home Minister
52.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Wednesday said that in the last few days the work to destroy peace has started in the state and the police are on alert mode. "After what happened in Delhi, we have inputs to spoil the atmosphere in Maharashtra, we've ordered police to be on alert mode," he said.

53.title: Delhi schools to continue in offline mode, separate SOP soon: Officials
53.article_body: Schools in Delhi will continue in offline mode while ensuring that COVID-19 protocols are strictly followed, officials said on Wednesday. "Schools have been asked to report all cases to the education department," a senior official said. The Delhi Disaster Management Authority has also decided to come up with a separate Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for schools after consulting experts.

54.title: Another DC foreign player tests COVID-19 positive ahead of tonight's match against PBKS
54.article_body: A second foreign player from Delhi Capitals squad tested positive for COVID-19 after a Rapid Antigen Test was conducted on Wednesday, the sixth such case in the camp. The BCCI will conduct another round of testing before Delhi Capitals' match against Punjab Kings, which is scheduled to begin at 7.30 pm. The match was earlier moved from Pune to Mumbai.

55.title: Was once told to leave an audition before giving my shot: Ayushmann
55.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana recalled auditioning for a role 11-12 years ago and said the audition was being held in front of other aspiring actors. "They were like 'read your lines'. I told them 'everybody will see, they'll take my ideas'," Ayushmann said. The actor asked if he could audition when everyone was gone. "They said 'no, please leave'," he added.

56.title: People were not ready for women-led films like 'Angry...': Pavleen
56.article_body: Discussing her film 'Angry Indian Goddesses' which released in 2015, actress Pavleen Gujral said people were not ready for women-led films at that stage, adding that the movie was "out of the ordinary". Pavleen stated that she did not act for three years after the film released. "Now it's...more about characters than who is playing the character," said Pavleen.

57.title: BrahMos supersonic missile creates hole in abandoned Indian ship; pic surfaces
57.article_body: A BrahMos supersonic cruise missile was successfully test fired from the Indian Navy warship INS Delhi on Tuesday, the Indian Navy said. "The missile without warhead created a hole in the abandoned ship. The missile travels at a speed of around 3,000 kmph and is difficult to intercept by air defence systems," BrahMos officials said.

58.title: Musk leaves a blank space in his latest tweet, users link it to buying Twitter
58.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "_______ is the Night," which Twitter users and reports linked to his plan of buying Twitter. It fuelled speculations that he'd launch a tender offer for Twitter shares if the board resists his proposal to acquire Twitter. "The missing word may be 'Tender' as per the F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel, or it could be 'Tonight'," Bloomberg reported.

59.title: Rahul sowing seeds of hatred, maligning country's image: BJP leader
59.article_body: BJP leader and Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that Rahul Gandhi is sowing seeds of hatred and maligning the country's image. "This is all you can expect from someone whose history is linked to corruption and riots," Thakur said. Gandhi had previously criticised the government for their use of bulldozers in violence-hit areas in Delhi and Madhya Pradesh.

60.title: 4 people killed, several injured in coal mine blasts in Poland
60.article_body: At least four people were killed and 20 others were injured in suspected methane blasts in a coal mine in Poland on Wednesday. According to mining company JSW, the explosions occurred at Pniowek mine in Pawlowice shortly after midnight at a depth of 1,000 meters. Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki expressed his condolences to the families of injured and deceased persons.

61.title: Over the moon with the reactions to 'Jayeshbhai...' trailer: Ranveer
61.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that he is "really over the moon" with the reactions to the trailer of his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "The reactions have actually exceeded my personal expectations which has left me surprised and I'm..happy about that," he added. Adding that his film is an entertainer, Ranveer said that the film has a social message.

62.title: Over 5 million people left Ukraine amid Russian invasion
62.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said that over five million people have fled Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. The conflict has displaced over 7 million people within Ukraine and around 13 million people are believed to be trapped in the war-affected areas, UNHCR added. It's the biggest refugee crisis in Europe since World War II.

63.title: Delhi likely to see light rain, thundershowers on Wednesday night
63.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted cloudy sky with light rainfall or thundershowers in Delhi on Wednesday night. The city is likely to receive light rainfall on Thursday as well. The maximum temperature in the national capital is likely to settle at around 41°C and the minimum temperature may be around 24°C on Wednesday.

64.title: Mudrex announces it is world's largest crypto index investing platform
64.article_body: Mudrex announced that it became the world's largest crypto index investing platform after its user base saw a 2400% increase in first quarter of 2022. Indian users contributed an increase of over 80% to this growth, the company added. Mudrex recently introduced SIPs to automate investments in Mudrex Coin Sets, which are baskets of cryptocurrencies based on a particular theme.

65.title: German Foreign Minister Baerbock visits Baltic nations on 3-day trip
65.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Wednesday began her three-day trip to the Baltic nations of Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia. All three countries are members of the EU and NATO. "If necessary, we will defend every square centimetre of territory of our joint alliance," Baerbock said. She is set to meet with each nation's leader in their respective capitals.

66.title: We're facing our last days: Ukrainian commander in Mariupol asks for help
66.article_body: A commander for the Ukrainian marines fighting Russian forces in Mariupol said his troops are "outnumbered" and are facing their "last days, if not hours". Serhiy Volyna urged the world leaders to help evacuate more than 500 wounded soldiers and hundreds of women and children he said were hiding with them at a steel plant in the besieged city.

67.title: LinkedIn most imitated brand for phishing in Q1 2022: Check Point
67.article_body: As per a report by Check Point Research (CPR), LinkedIn, for the first time ever, has become the most often imitated brand by cyber criminals for phishing. CPR stated that LinkedIn accounted for 52% of all phishing attempts during Q1 2022. It was followed by DHL (14%), Google (7%), Microsoft (6%), FedEx (6%), WhatsApp (4%) and Amazon (2%).

68.title: Video shows man holding gun while dancing with dancer in Bihar; IAS officer reacts
68.article_body: A video showing a man with a gun in his hand while dancing with a female dancer in Bihar's Gopalganj has surfaced online. The man can also be seen pointing the gun at her. Reacting to the video on Twitter, IAS officer Sanjay Kumar said, "This makes me speechless and also makes me realise the level of 'cultural depravity'."

69.title: Swiss authorities approve 1st cannabis sale pilot project in summer
69.article_body: Swiss health authorities on Tuesday approved a pilot project for the sale and recreational consumption of cannabis in Basel this summer. The city's government said about 400 people will be allowed to purchase cannabis from select pharmacies later this summer. The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health said the aim is to test whether cannabis consumption changes when legally bought.

70.title: Excess weight can nearly double the risk of womb cancer: Study
70.article_body: According to research, lifelong excess weight in women can be linked to womb cancer. The study states for every 5 extra BMI units, a woman's risk of developing womb cancer is almost doubled. Researchers studied 14 traits that linked obesity to womb cancer and found two hormones - fasting insulin and testosterone that increased risk of developing cancer in participants.

71.title: Bacteria in urine may signal aggressive forms of prostate cancer: Study
71.article_body: Researchers have found five types of bacteria, namely, Anaerococcus, Peptoniphilus, Porphyromonas, Fenollaria and Fusobacterium in urine and tissue samples of 600 men with or without prostate cancer. Detection of any of these specific anaerobic bacteria in the participants hinted at the presence of higher grades of prostate cancer and more rapid progression to aggressive disease, researchers said.

72.title: BJP's Narasimha Rao calls JCB 'Jihad Control Board' in tweet, deletes later
72.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP GVL Narasimha Rao took to Twitter to call JCB 'Jihad Control Board'. However, he later deleted the tweet. His tweet came after Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) began an anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri, where violence had taken place after clashes erupted between groups during a Hanuman Jayanti procession.

73.title: TN to create corpus of Tamil words for terms used in various sectors
73.article_body: Tamil Nadu government would create a corpus of Tamil words for terms to be used in various sectors, including medical, engineering and technology, Minister for Tamil Official Language and Tamil Culture, Thangam Thenarasu said. According to him, ₹35 lakh would be allocated for the same. He added that ₹5.36 crore would be allocated for competitions in Tamil-related subjects every year.

74.title: Tag of Bulbul from 'Kumkum...' will always be with me; I take pride in it: Mrunal
74.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, who made a shift to films after featuring in the television show 'Kumkum Bhagya' as 'Bulbul', said that the small screen taught her professionalism. "The tag of Bulbul will stay with me forever. I take immense pride that I started with television," she added. Mrunal said television was her grooming process where she learned the technical process.

75.title: Yami recalls auditioning for 'Vicky Donor' after film completes 10 yrs
75.article_body: Yami Gautam, taking to Instagram, shared a picture from the studio where she auditioned for the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'. "The place where it all began! Started my journey auditioning for 'Vicky Donor' right here," she wrote. The film completed 10 years of its release on Wednesday. "Recent visit to this studio took me down the memory lane," Yami added.

76.title: Canada to keep mask mandate on for public transport: Minister
76.article_body: Canada has decided to continue the mask mandate for people while using public transportation for the foreseeable future. "Masks are proving to provide additional layers of protection," said Canadian Transportation Minister Omar Alghabra. "[The] regulation is in place and is based on the advice we receive from our experts," he added. His remarks came after US dropped the mask mandate.

77.title: Uber, Lyft drop face mask mandate for riders, drivers in US
77.article_body: Ride-hailing companies Uber and Lyft on Tuesday announced they are ending their face mask mandates for both riders and drivers in the US. A federal judge on Monday ruled that the government mandate was unlawful, removing its enforcement on public transportation in the country. Uber introduced a face mask mandate for its delivery workers, riders and drivers in May 2020.

78.title: UP govt planning to develop Ayodhya as 'Climate-Smart City'
78.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is planning to develop Ayodhya as a 'Climate-Smart City' focusing on renewable energy. According to a government spokesperson, a 1,200-acre wide Greenfield township has been proposed to meet the demand of people looking forward to staying in a self-sustainable township. Further, the CM has also ordered officials to speed up the development of the holy city.

79.title: I might have to get umpire a beer after that: Hazlewood on Stoinis wide-ball incident
79.article_body: Referring to umpire Chris Gaffaney not calling his delivery to LSG's Marcus Stoinis a 'wide' in 19th over despite it moving beyond the tram line, RCB fast bowler Josh Hazlewood said, "I got pretty lucky on that one." He added, "I might have to get umpire a beer after that." Hazlewood went on to dismiss Stoinis on the next ball.

80.title: Wasim Jaffer shares meme to describe Virat Kohli's 'luck' while batting
80.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a meme to describe Virat Kohli's 'luck' while batting. Kohli has scored 119 runs in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.83. His strike rate in the ongoing tournament is 123.96. Kohli was dismissed for golden duck against LSG on Tuesday. Kohli has been run-out twice in IPL 2022.

81.title: BJP working as carrier of Hindutva: Devendra Fadnavis
81.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that the Hindutva concept is an intricate part of Indian DNA and the BJP is working as the carrier of Hindutva. Fadnavis added, "Hindutva is a concept that is not based on pooja or karma. Hindutva is a concept that is geographically connected with India," Fadnavis added.

82.title: 2 bike-borne men rob money transfer firm employees of ₹10.9 lakh in Ludhiana
82.article_body: Two bike-borne men took away ₹10.9 lakh from two employees of a money transfer firm after threatening them with a gun near Ludhiana’s grain market on Gill Road on Tuesday. While the victims were returning to the office on a bike after collecting the amount, the robbers waylaid them and executed the crime.

83.title: Mika got offended as Shoojit called him 'Mickey' during 'Vicky..': Ayushmann
83.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that singer Mika Singh got offended after filmmaker Shoojit Sircar called him "Mickey" during shoot of 'Vicky Donor'. "I told him 'Sir his name is Mika.' He is so bad with names...He would often call me Anshuman and call Yami Yamini...Shoojit Da was so bad with names, now of course he knows our name," he added.

84.title: Kabir Singh pushed me to quit smoking; I was like 'I'm done, I can't': Shahid
84.article_body: Speaking about his lifestyle changes, Shahid Kapoor said he's disciplined when it comes to sleep now. "I used to be [an]...insomniac and I flipped that after I had...kids," he added. "I've been a smoker on and off but now for...few years, I haven't smoked. I think 'Kabir Singh'...did it for me. [I was like] 'I can't. I'm done'," he said.

85.title: YouTube blocks HK's sole leadership candidate under US sanctions
85.article_body: YouTube has blocked the account of Hong Kong's sole leadership candidate John Lee as part of US sanctions. "With regards to some [social] media [platforms] which I will have no access to, I feel disappointed but this will not affect my election effort," Lee said. Meta said it had taken steps to prevent the use of payments services by Lee.

86.title: Flagged infighting, but Congress didn’t act: Ripun Bora after joining TMC
86.article_body: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora, who recently joined Trinamool Congress, said that he always alerted the party high command about the "corrosive effects of infighting, but no action was taken". "Some of my senior colleagues kept demanding my removal. When they couldn't replace me, they did everything to not let me become the CM," he said during an interview.

87.title: Situation returning to normalcy in Delhi's Jahangirpuri: Police
87.article_body: The situation in Delhi's Jahangirpuri is heading towards normalcy amid heavy deployment of security personnel in the violence-hit area, police said on Tuesday. Over 500 police personnel and six companies of additional force have been deployed in the area, reports said. Some shops, mainly for groceries, have opened and the movement of people is becoming normal, police said.

88.title: Elephant, which killed 5 people, found dead in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband
88.article_body: A female elephant, that killed five people earlier this month, was found dead in the Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh. The 35-year-old animal's carcass was found in the submergence area of Sikaser dam in Dhawalpur forest range on Tuesday, Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Mayank Agrawal said. According to Agrawal, a preliminary investigation found inflammation in the elephant's buccal cavity.

89.title: Lakhs of people face power outages in US caused by snowstorm
89.article_body: Lakhs of people reportedly faced power outages in various states across the US owing to a snowstorm. The outages were reported in New York, Pennsylvania, Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont. In New York state alone, over 1.95 lakh people faced power cuts. The state government said the snowstorm brought down trees and disrupted power lines.

90.title: Boney Kapoor to launch daughter Anshula Kapoor in Bollywood: Reports
90.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor will reportedly launch her daughter Anshula Kapoor in Bollywood. According to reports, since Boney is also acting in a film, he feels if Anshula too joins films as an actor, the Kapoors will become a 5-star family, including him and his kids. Reports added he has seen Anshula in school plays and vouches for her acting talent.

91.title: Discrimination: KTR on govt's decision to move GCTM to Guj from Hyd
91.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said that the Centre's decision to move WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine (GCTM) to Gujarat from Hyderabad is discrimination against Telangana. KTR tweeted, "The saga of PM Narendra Modi Ji's discrimination against Telangana goes on unabated." Notably, PM Modi on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for WHO GCTM at Jamnagar in Gujarat.

92.title: We don't divide people, we stay like family: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
92.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that in Bengal we don't divide people on the basis of caste, creed or religion, "we stay like family". "Irrespective of one being from any part of the country, whenever one's in Bengal, one's part of our family and should be comfortable here," Banerjee further said while addressing Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata.

93.title: Blackstone, Vista rule out financing Musk's $43 bn Twitter bid: Report
93.article_body: Private equity firms Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners have ruled out financing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy Twitter, Bloomberg reported. Brookfield Asset Management has also decided not to finance the bid. Blackstone and Vista have decided not to finance any potential bid for Twitter, even if it's from another party besides Musk, at the moment.

94.title: Never seen him struggle like this: Pietersen on Kohli's golden duck
94.article_body: Reacting to RCB batter Virat Kohli's golden duck against LSG which marked 100 professional matches for Kohli without scoring a ton, ex-RCB captain Kevin Pietersen said he has "never seen" Kohli struggle like this. Kohli has scored 119 runs in seven IPL 2022 matches so far. He is currently ranked 34th in IPL 2022's list of leading run-getters.

95.title: Jio loses mobile subscribers for 3rd straight month; Airtel gains
95.article_body: Reliance Jio lost 36.6 lakh mobile subscribers in February, the first time that it has lost subscribers for the third consecutive month, data by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) showed. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel, the only telco to gain subscribers in February, added 15.91 lakh new customers. Vodafone Idea lost 15.32 lakh users while BSNL lost 1.11 lakh customers.

96.title: We're looking for collective effort to get off the mark: MI's Unadkat
96.article_body: MI pacer Jaydev Unadkat has said they're not looking too far ahead and focusing on putting a "collective" effort to first get off the mark. He added, "There's no point in looking at the bigger picture. The state we're in, we're just looking to put some things right." MI, who are winless in six games, will face CSK on Thursday.

97.title: Video shows jawan carrying pregnant woman to hospital on cot in Chhattisgarh
97.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a jawan of the District Reserve Guard force carrying a pregnant woman to a hospital on a cot in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district. The jawan was accompanied by some locals. The woman and her newborn baby are in good health, Inspector General of Police in  Bastar Range Sundarraj Pattilingam said.

98.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases as India reports jump in cases?
98.article_body: With India reporting 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, the data released by the Health Ministry showed that there are 12,340 active coronavirus cases in India. Kerala has the highest number of active cases with 2,432 cases. This is followed by 1,947 active cases in Delhi, 1,529 in Karnataka, 1,351 in Assam and 1,125 in Haryana.

99.title: RCB require such a bowler to win IPL: Kaif on Hazlewood's 4-wicket haul
99.article_body: Reacting to RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood's four-wicket haul against LSG, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said RCB require such a bowler to win the IPL. "The first spell he bowled with the new ball, you will spend money to watch a spell like that," added Kaif. "Hazlewood always reminds us [of ex-Australian pacer] Glenn McGrath," stated ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan.

100.title: Bulldoze BJP HQ, Amit Shah's house to stop riots: Raghav Chadha
100.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said communal riots in India will stop if BJP headquarters and Home Minister Amit Shah's house are bulldozed. "BJP rehabilitated Rohingyas and people from Bangladesh in large numbers so that they can help the party in orchestrating these riots...Ask BJP where these people have been rehabilitated to know where future riots will take place," Chadha added.

101.title: Prashant Kishor has become brand in country: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
101.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor has become a brand in the country, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said. "In 2014, he was with PM Narendra Modi, then with (Bihar CM) Nitish Kumar and then with Congress in Punjab and many others," Gehlot added. "We also take advice from experts and agencies. His experience might be useful in uniting the Opposition," Gehlot stated.

102.title: Demolition drive in Jahangirpuri unconstitutional: CPI(M)'s Brinda
102.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Wednesday termed the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri unconstitutional. She said, "The law and the Constitution have been bulldozed by carrying out illegal demolitions." After the drive was stopped, Brinda appealed to the people of Jahangirpuri to maintain peace and harmony and wait for Supreme Court's next order.

103.title: Made sure she is protected: Prince Harry after meeting Queen Elizabeth
103.article_body: UK's Prince Harry said he made sure that his grandmother Queen Elizabeth II had the "right people around her" and was "protected" when he met the British monarch last week. Harry and his wife Meghan met the Queen at Windsor Castle on their first trip to Britain since quitting royal duties in 2020. It was "great" meeting her, Harry added.

104.title: Auditioned in 2017, got call after 2 yrs; was hard to recall project: RRR star
104.article_body: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum said that she auditioned for the role of Loki in 2017 and forgot about it after that. "Two years later, I got a call that I have been shortlisted, it was hard to recall which project exactly...The moment I realised...that I have been finalised for such a strong character...I felt extremely happy and grateful," she added.

105.title: B'wood has forgotten heroism; films like RRR, KGF have created havoc: Sanjay
105.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said "heroism" in Bollywood has been sidelined in favour of slice-of-life movies. "Why have we forgotten heroism in our industry? The South...always believed in heroism...South films like 'RRR', 'Pushpa' or...'KGF'...are creating havoc all over India," he said. "Why are we forgetting Bihar, UP, Jharkhand...This is 90% of our audience, they're hungry to see our movies," he added.

106.title: Luck hasn't favoured Kohli so far but it's time to deliver: Jaffer
106.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said luck hasn't favoured RCB batter Virat Kohli so far in IPL 2022, but he has to now deliver with the business end of the tournament approaching. Kohli was dismissed for a golden duck in RCB's last match against LSG. It marked Kohli's fourth IPL golden duck and his first golden duck in IPL since 2017.

107.title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell out of induced coma, still in ICU
107.article_body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell has come out of the induced coma but still remains in the ICU after he suffered a heart attack last week in the UK. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "They've taken the heavy sedation off, so he's actually woken up," said Campbell's brother Mark.

108.title: Ethereum network has many single points of failure: Twitter's Dorsey
108.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in his response to a tweet stated that the Ethereum network "has many single points of failure" and the projects built on it are "not interesting" to him. This comes after Ethereum Co-founder, Vitalik Buterin, commented on Elon Musk's Twitter bid saying he opposes wealthy people or organisations' "hostile" take over of social media firms.

109.title: GB Nagar Police serve over 900 notices for violation of loudspeaker ban
109.article_body: Around 900 religious places have been served notices for violating the loudspeaker ban in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar, police said on Wednesday. This includes 602 temples, 265  mosques, 16 other religious places, 217 procession houses and 175 DJ operators. "If any religious place, DJ operator does not follow the instructions...strict action will be taken against them," the notice read.

110.title: Kerala Police arrests man from Assam for murdering wife
110.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday arrested a man from Assam's Nagaon for allegedly murdering his wife in their rented house on April 1, an officer said. The man and his wife, both hailing from Nagaon, had been staying in the Perumbur area where he worked, the officer added. Kerala Police traced the man to his village during the investigation.

111.title: Defence Ministry exceeds domestic procurement target of 64% in FY 2021-22
111.article_body: The Ministry of Defence (MoD) in a statement on Wednesday said that it exceeded its target of 64% meant for domestic purchases in the financial year 2021-22. The ministry said it "utilised 65.50% of capital acquisition budget on indigenous procurements through Indian Industry to achieve PM Narendra Modi's vision of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'."

112.title: UK judge orders extradition of Assange to US; will face 175-year sentence
112.article_body: A UK judge has ordered the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the US where he will face a 175-year sentence. Assange is wanted in the US on 18 criminal charges after WikiLeaks published thousands of classified files and diplomatic cables in 2010. The decision will now move to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

113.title: Pleased with Rahul's dismissal as RCB have struggled against him: Hesson
113.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said they were "very happy" after the dismissal of LSG captain KL Rahul, as RCB have struggled to dismiss Rahul in the past. "I would like to say that [Rahul's dismissal]...was a pre-planned move but it was not," added Hesson. Rahul was dismissed for 30 as RCB defeated LSG by 18 runs.

114.title: Chernobyl nuclear plant has restored ties with state regulator: IAEA
114.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said Ukraine has informed the agency that it has restored direct communications between the Chernobyl nuclear power plant and the state atomic power regulator after Russian troops left the facility. Russian forces had occupied the defunct power station soon after invading Ukraine on February 24 but left on March 31, the IAEA said.

115.title: Controlled blast at construction site damages windows of adjacent homes in Pune
115.article_body: A contractor of a residential project in Pune's Sus area has been booked after a controlled blast at the site damaged window panes of apartments at neighbouring buildings. A complainant said the explosion also damaged the windows of some of the cars. "The real estate developer has been directed to submit...necessary documents that gave him mining permission," an official said.

116.title: There may be 10 new signings: Rangnick on Man Utd's 0-4 loss vs Liverpool
116.article_body: Reacting to Manchester United's 0-4 defeat against Liverpool in a Premier League match, Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick said the club may sign 10 new players. "It's embarrassing...completely disappointing, in a way also humiliating," added Ralf. "We just have to accept that Liverpool are...six years ahead of us. They have 25 Formula One racing cars," stated Ralf.

117.title: Jupiter moon Europa could be capable of harbouring life: Study
117.article_body: A study has revealed that the similarities between Jupiter's moon Europa's surface and a landform in Greenland hint that the moon may be capable of harbouring life. Researchers studied similarities between double ridges across Europa's surface and a smaller version of it in Greenland. The refreezing of liquid subsurface water drove the formation of Greenland's double ridge.

118.title: All should condemn atrocities by TRS leaders: Telangana BJP chief
118.article_body: BJP Telangana unit President Bandi Sanjay Kumar has said that everybody should condemn the "atrocities by the TRS leaders". He further urged the party workers to hold black flag protests against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a BJP activist, Sai Ganesh, reportedly died by suicide in Telangana's Khammam on April 16.

119.title: Action taken on 'crime', not 'community': Minister on Jahangirpuri arrests
119.article_body: Responding to the action taken after violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday said that the arrests were made on the basis of "crime" not "caste and community". He further said that those trying to hide a crime behind "communal cover" want to create "fear" in society through a "caucus of criminals".

120.title: HDFC to sell 10% stake in HDFC Capital for ₹184 crore
120.article_body: HDFC on Wednesday announced that it's selling a 10% stake in its private equity arm HDFC Capital Advisors to a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) for about ₹184 crore. HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said ADIA's investment will enable HDFC Capital to leverage ADIA's global expertise. HDFC had announced its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month.

121.title: Manchester City pay tribute to 'KGF: Chapter 2' with pic, Farhan Akhtar says 'Brilliant'
121.article_body: Premier League club Manchester City posted a tribute to Kannada film 'KGF: Chapter 2' on social media on Wednesday. The team shared a picture of their players Kevin de Bruyne, Ilkay Gündogan and Phil Foden and wrote, "Our very own KGF!" Actor-producer Farhan Akhtar, who has presented the Hindi version of the film, commented on the post, "Brilliant."

122.title: Married man runs away with woman; Guj HC orders him to pay 50% of police search cost
122.article_body: Gujarat High Court has ordered a married man in Ahmedabad to pay half the amount spent by the government to trace a 20-year-old woman he ran away with last year. "We deem it appropriate to direct 50% of the said amount which shall be sum of ₹55,000," court said. The woman's father said he spent ₹8.06 lakh to trace her.

123.title: Govt favouring rioters, targeting a community: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
123.article_body: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on Wednesday criticised the government over the demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. Its official, Niaz Ahmed Farooqui, said that by doing this following riots in the area, the government is only favouring the rioters and targeting a community. The government shouldn't do this, he added. He further said he had written to the authorities to stop the drive.

124.title: 2 newborns die at Raj govt hospital after radiant warmers get overheated
124.article_body: Two infants, who were 11 and four days old, died at government-run hospital in Rajasthan's Beawar on Monday after radiant warmers meant to keep them warm, got overheated due to voltage fluctuation after power cut. Dr KL Meena, Director of Family Welfare, said appropriate voltage for the warmer is 230 volts but it shot up to 332 volts after fluctuation.

125.title: What reasons did Netflix give for losing members for the first time in 10 years?
125.article_body: Netflix revealed that 2,00,000 people left the streaming service in the first three months of the year, marking its first fall in subscribers in more than 10 years. Netflix gave several reasons including COVID-19 disruptions, account sharing, sluggish economic growth, increasing inflation, and Russia's invasion of Ukraine for slower growth. It also cited competition from YouTube, Amazon, and Hulu.

126.title: Brinda Karat blocks bulldozer to stop demolition in Delhi, waves court papers
126.article_body: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat stood in front of a bulldozer to stop a demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Wednesday. A video shows Karat waiving court papers at the spot after the Supreme Court stayed the demolition drive. The North Delhi Municipal Corporation on Wednesday sent bulldozers to remove alleged illegal encroachments in Jahangirpuri.

127.title: 4 men trapped in 50-foot-deep sewage tank die in Haryana's Hisar
127.article_body: Four men died after they were trapped in a 50-foot-deep sewage tank in Haryana's Hisar, officials said. The deceased's family members and locals protested against the district administration. They demanded ₹1 crore financial assistance and a government job for one family member of each of the deceased. Two of the victims had gone inside the tank to repair a motor.

128.title: Netflix may offer cheaper ad-supported plans amid subscriber loss
128.article_body: Netflix is thinking about offering a lower-priced version of the service with advertising amid a fall in the number of subscribers for the first time in over a decade. Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that even though he's been "against the complexity of advertising", he's a "bigger fan of consumer choice". Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.

129.title: Conduct nursing admission through NEET, add 5 new paramedical courses: UP CM
129.article_body: Conduct admission to GNM and BSc nursing courses through the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET), UP CM Yogi Adityanath said while reviewing the action plan of the medical and health departments. "An action plan should be prepared to add five new paramedical courses – OT technician, radiotherapy technician, dialysis technician, anaesthesia technician and MRI technician," he added.

130.title: Fatehabad man arrested for cheating Chandigarh woman of ₹83,979
130.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested a man from Haryana’s Fatehabad for cheating a woman of ₹83,979 in February. The complainant said a man called her over phone, claiming to be a bank employee and informed her of an issue with her credit card. Later, he took details of other credit cards following which a transaction was made from one of her cards.

131.title: Healthcare insurer Loop raises $25 mn, Vinod Khosla invests too
131.article_body: Pune-based healthcare and insurance startup Loop has raised $25 million in a Series B round co-led by General Catalyst and Elevation Capital. The round also saw participation from Vinod Khosla and Khosla Ventures, Sierra Ventures, as well as a new investor, Optum Ventures. The funding follows Loop's $12 million funding from General Catalyst and Elevation six months ago.

132.title: Pre-monsoon showers to hit Maharashtra till Saturday: IMD
132.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light rainfall and thunderstorms across several districts in Maharashtra till Saturday. If it rains, this will reportedly be considered the state's first pre-monsoon rain this year. The day temperatures in the state might also drop marginally during the next three days, IMD predicted.

133.title: I am my own role model: Fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022 Umran Malik
133.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who is the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, said, "Speed comes naturally to me. This year I am trying to work on hitting the right areas." He added, "I always used to bowl fast. I am my own role model." He stated, "It is good to see such big legends tweeting about me."

134.title: People say 'you're unadorned' if you don't get surgeries done: Palak Tiwari
134.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari opened up about the double beauty standards she's witnessed in the entertainment industry as a newcomer. She said, "If you have these surgeries...they have things to say about it, but if you don't (get those things done), then you're unadorned and not ready." "So you can never really truly please [the] audience," she added.

135.title: Sri Lanka orders probe after anti-govt protester shot dead by police
135.article_body: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa said he expects police to "strictly" and "impartially" investigate clashes with anti-government protesters that led to the first death in weeks of civil unrest over an economic crisis. A dozen people were also injured after police fired live ammunition to scatter protesters on Tuesday in Rambukkana town. Rajapaksa said he's "deeply distressed following the tragedy".

136.title: PM Modi announces special AYUSH visa category, AYUSH mark
136.article_body: PM Narendra Modi announced a special AYUSH visa category and AYUSH mark on Wednesday. He said, "Soon, India is going to introduce a special AYUSH visa category for foreign nationals who want to come to India to take advantage of AYUSH therapy." He added, "AYUSH mark will be applied to the highest quality AYUSH products made in India."

137.title: Our next match is against RCB, I want to take Kohli's wicket: Umran Malik
137.article_body: Ahead of SRH's match against RCB on Saturday, pacer Umran Malik said he wants to take Virat Kohli's wicket in that game. "We had a match against LSG...I really wanted to get KL Rahul out...[now] I want to get Kohli out. I'm a big fan of both of them," he stated. During the SRH-LSG match, T Natarajan dismissed Rahul.

138.title: Hyd's 216-year-old British Residency to reopen for public in May
138.article_body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad has been restored and it'll be open for public from May, Telangana Minister V Srinivas Goud said. "It was in 2013 that the building was taken up for restoration by World Monuments Fund...at a cost of ₹17 crore," an official said. It served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad.

139.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cuts stake in SAIL from 1.09% to 0.32%
139.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cut his stake in the Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) during the January-March quarter, data on the company's website showed. As of January 14, Rekha Jhunjhunwala, Rakesh's wife, owned a 0.49% stake in SAIL while Rakesh Jhunjhunwala owned a 0.32% stake. He had earlier cut his stake from 1.76% to 1.09% in December 2021.

140.title: Never hit Amber Heard or any woman in my life: Johnny Depp tells court
140.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor denied all the domestic abuse allegations against him and called them "heinous". "Never did I...reach the point of striking Ms Heard in any way, nor have I ever struck any woman in my life," he added. Earlier, Amber's lawyer had accused Depp of penetrating Amber with a liquor bottle.

141.title: Phones of Raut, Khadse tapped by labelling them 'anti-social': Police
141.article_body: Phones of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and Nationalist Congress Party leader Eknath Khadse were tapped after labelling them both as "anti-social" elements, Mumbai Police said. Khadse's phone was tapped for 67 days and that of Raut for 60 days, police added. This comes after police started the investigation into the illegal phone tapping case against IPS officer Rashmi Shukla.

142.title: Garbage trucks' fitness certificates must: BBMP after 3 deaths in month
142.article_body: BBMP has mandated fitness certificates for all garbage trucks, including those belonging to contractors. This comes a day after a 40-year-old woman died when a BBMP's garbage truck ran over her, third such fatal incident within a month in Bengaluru. Meanwhile, BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta said that they're working with transport and traffic police department to enhance road safety measures.

143.title: Four-lane service road to come up between Kalindi Kunj, Maharani Bagh
143.article_body: A 6-km-long four-lane service road will come up along the river banks between South Delhi's Maharani Bagh and Kalindi Kunj areas, according to officials. The service roads will help people commuting between Noida and Delhi and will provide relief to residents of densely populated areas like Okhla, Jamia Nagar, Batla House and more, an official said.

144.title: 12 shops gutted in fire at Pune's Kharadi, no casualties reported
144.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that broke out in Pune's Kharadi area on Wednesday, fire officials said. The fire started in one of the shops in the Ubale Nagar area at 10 am, they added. Six fire tenders that were rushed to the spot took one hour to douse the fire. No casualties were reported in the incident.

145.title: Starlink helped restore 10 km of cable connection between villages: Ukraine
145.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has said SpaceX's Starlink helped restore 10 kilometres of cable connection between villages quickly in the Chernihiv region. "It wouldn't be possible to restore 10 km of...connection between villages...after serious battles so quick. Normally it takes few months," he added. Baryshivka-Net resumed the network for five villages with one Starlink.

146.title: Malegaon blast case witness asks MP Police for security, fears going missing
146.article_body: A witness in Malegaon blast case, Jitendra Bhakroda, has asked for security from Madhya Pradesh Police. Reports said that Bhakroda did not appear in the NIA court recently and stated that he fears that he will also go missing like another witness, Dilip Patidar. "Dilip is still missing after...being taken away by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad...in November 2008," he said.

147.title: Class 3 boy peeps out of school bus window, dies after head hits pole in UP
147.article_body: A class 3 boy died on Wednesday after his head hit a pole while he was peeping out school bus window in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. "Based on the allegations of laxity levelled by his family against the school, we've taken the authorities for questioning," police said. The family said the school authorities told them that he peeped out to vomit.

148.title: Uber hikes fare rates by 10% in Bengaluru amid rise in fuel prices
148.article_body: Uber has announced a 10% hike in its fare rates in Bengaluru amid a rise in fuel prices. An official said the move was "to help cushion drivers from the impact of a spike in fuel prices", adding it'll continue to track fuel prices and take further steps as needed. Ola is yet to take a decision on hiking fares.

149.title: 12 shops gutted in fire in Pune's Kharadi, no casualty reported
149.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that started in Kharadi area of Pune on Wednesday, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported. Six fire tenders were sent to the spot and the fire was doused in one hour. In Kharadi area, several shops are located next to each other and there are some furniture outlets and eateries too.

150.title: 2 mobile phone thieves held in Pune, 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh seized
150.article_body: Two history-sheeters have been arrested for allegedly stealing mobile phones from bus passengers and those waiting at bus stops in Pune and 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh were seized from them. The matter came to light after the duo snatched the mobile phone of a man who had come to a bus stop near Sassoon hospital.

151.title: Nimrat Kaur shares pic of transformation after gaining 15 kg for 'Dasvi'
151.article_body: Nimrat Kaur shared pictures showing her transformation for the film 'Dasvi'. Revealing that she gained around 15 kg, Nimrat wrote that while she relished the process after an initial hesitation, some around her often gave her snide remarks. She concluded by asking people to be more sensitive, while adding, "Make only your mind and body your business. No one else's."

152.title: 13-yr-old girl raped by 80 men in 8 months in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana
152.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was raped by 80 men in eight months at different brothels in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana after she was taken away by a woman. Police identified Sawarna Kumari as the main accused who forced the minor into prostitution. The police, who said they are searching for some more accused, on Tuesday made 10 arrests.

153.title: Hid face from Shweta Tiwari, no one else: Palak on being clicked with Ibrahim
153.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari said she hid her face from her mother Shweta Tiwari when she was photographed with Ibrahim Ali Khan. "I...told her one hour back that I've left for home...I was like 'mummy there's...so much traffic'...and she was like 'fine'...The second paps came I was like 'mom will see me'...she sent me that picture...said 'you bl***y liar'," Palak added.

154.title: Ranchi woman duped of ₹3.45 lakh on pretext of winning ₹25 lakh lottery, 2 held
154.article_body: Two people were arrested for allegedly duping a 41-year-old woman in Jharkhand's Ranchi. The accused had reached out to her through e-mail, saying she won a lottery of ₹25 lakh and a luxury car, police said. They then asked the woman to pay ₹3.45 lakh to claim the prize money. However,  the duo stopped responding after receiving the money.

155.title: Virat Kohli is overcooked, cannot lose his services with a fried brain: Ravi Shastri
155.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who has scored 119 runs for RCB in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.83, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Kohli is overcooked." He added, "He needs a break because he has got six to seven years of cricket left in him and you don't want to lose that with a fried brain."

156.title: China doubles purchase of Russian coking coal amid discount
156.article_body: China more than doubled imports of coking coal from Russia in March, buying it at a discount as other nations ban Russian imports due to the Russia-Ukraine war. China's coking coal imports from Russia jumped to 1.4 million tonnes in March 2022, compared to 5,50,000 tonnes for March 2021. Coking coal is essential for the production of iron and steel.

157.title: PM Modi gives WHO chief a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai'; his reaction goes viral
157.article_body: While addressing an event in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi gave WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai', based on the Tulsi herbal plant. The WHO chief, who was sharing the stage with PM Modi, could be seen laughing in the viral video. "He (Tedros) told me 'I'm fully Gujarati now. Give me a Gujarati name'," PM Modi said.

158.title: Switch off bulldozers of hate, switch on power plants: Rahul to PM
158.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "switch off bulldozers of hate and switch on power plants". Gandhi's reference was to the use of bulldozers in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Madhya Pradesh. Referring to the coal shortage issue, Gandhi added, "Modi ji, stagflation is looming. Power cuts will crush small industries, leading to more job losses."

159.title: Pakistan's 1st Sikh police officer allegedly kidnapped by Pak intelligence agencies
159.article_body: BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa in a Twitter post said, "Pakistan media speculates that first Sikh police officer of Pakistan Gulab Singh Shaheen has allegedly been abducted by Pakistan intelligence agencies and taken to some undisclosed place." "We are concerned about his safety and family. Urging High Commission of India in Pakistan to address this issue at earliest," he added.

160.title: COVID-19 situation completely under control in Maharashtra: Health Min Tope
160.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that COVID-19 situation in the state is "completely under control". "I've held a detailed review of COVID-19 situation in the state. There is no need to worry as there has not been a significant rise in cases," he added. "We are vaccinating those in the 12-15 & 15-18 age groups," he further said.

161.title: Xbox head of research & design quits Microsoft after nearly 20 yrs
161.article_body: Xbox's head of research and design Chris Novak has announced that he is leaving Microsoft after nearly 20 years. In his latest role, Novak led the user experience for things like Xbox Game Pass, Xbox Cloud Gaming, and Xbox Live, according to his LinkedIn. At Microsoft, he also held the roles of Design Architect and Design Director.

162.title: Odisha curtails summer vacation for universities, colleges to 16 days
162.article_body: The Odisha government has curtailed summer vacation for all higher education institutions to 16 days in order to compensate for the academic loss due to COVID-19 pandemic. As per order, the summer vacation will be allowed only from June 1 to June 16 this year.  If needed, extra classes should be held on holidays and working days, the order read.

163.title: Centre extends ceasefire agreements with 3 Naga insurgent groups by a year
163.article_body: The Central government has extended the ceasefire agreements signed with three Naga insurgent groups for one more year. The agreements have been established with the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-NK (NSCN-NK), National Socialist Council of Nagaland- Reformation (NSCN-R) and National Socialist Council of Nagaland K-Khango (NSCN K-Khango), the Union Home Ministry said in a statement.

164.title: I was a Miss India but was offered item songs or five-minute glam roles: Sonali
164.article_body: Speaking about her journey in Bollywood, actress Sonali Seygall, who starred in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' said she didn't get any work between her first film and second film. She added. "I was a Miss India. I was...offered item songs or five-minute glam roles." "People...assume...good looking people can't act until you prove yourself as Deepika Padukone did in 'Cocktail'," she said.

165.title: Parts of Pune to not receive water supply on April 21
165.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said there'll be no water supply in some parts of the city on April 21. The affected areas will be Aundh, Baner, ITI Road, Spicer college, Bopodi, Old Mumbai-Pune road, and Anand Park. The water supply will be disrupted because the pipeline near Sindh Society has to be shifted for Pune Metro work, PMC said.

166.title: Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas, he says Kejriwal will one day betray Punjab CM
166.article_body: Punjab Police have registered a case against Kumar Vishwas for promoting enmity by allegedly making false statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Tagging Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, Vishwas tweeted, "I'm warning you that the man sitting in Delhi, whom you are allowing to play with the power given by the people of Punjab, will one day betray you and Punjab."

167.title: Telangana BJP to launch state-wide protests against 'atrocities’ by TRS
167.article_body: The Telangana unit of the BJP has decided to hold state-wide protests on Wednesday against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh, B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption.

168.title: Use masks in closed spaces, advises Karanataka government
168.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi, the Karnataka government has advised the use of face masks at least in closed spaces and indoors to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the state. "Once...cases spike in Delhi, it also tends to increase in other parts...like Bengaluru. It's good for us to exercise caution," Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said.

169.title: Railways to waterproof Mumbai's AC locals ahead of monsoon
169.article_body: Central Railway will waterproof all Mumbai AC local trains ahead of monsoon to ensure that rain water does not enter the electrical systems placed on the roof of the trains. "Waterproofing is done for additional safety...As the electrical system is not present inside the underslung, minimal waterlogging on tracks will not impact operations," said a senior Central Railway official.

170.title: What's happening with umpiring in IPL 2022, it's quite pathetic: Kris Srikkanth
170.article_body: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth has criticised the umpiring in the ongoing IPL season, stating that it's quite pathetic and "small bad decisions are leading to big outcomes". He added, "Wake up and put some people who actually can be [umpires]." During the RCB-LSG match, Hazlewood's wide delivery wasn't called wide, leading to Marcus Stoinis' wicket on the next ball.

171.title: I was so raw, it's embarrassing: Ayushmann on watching 'Vicky..' after 10 yrs
171.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana watched a scene from his debut film 'Vicky Donor' after ten years. "I was so raw, it's embarrassing," Ayushmann said, adding, "I'm so much better now! I'm seriously watching it after 10 years. I don't watch my films. I only watch them on the edit and maybe on the screening. It's just too much."

172.title: I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's: Jayawardena to troll
172.article_body: After former Sri Lankan cricketer Mahela Jayawardena condemned police in Sri Lanka opening fire at anti-government protesters amid economic crisis, a man tweeted, "Sudden growth of b***s." Responding to the troll, Jayawardena wrote, "I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's…so don’t worry about mine. Stay [focussed]."

173.title: Trolling not done, kindly make amends: Ex-cricketer Ganesh to LSG for calling RCB 'beta'
173.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh criticised LSG for calling RCB 'beta' on Twitter. Ahead of LSG-RCB match, LSG had tweeted, "Pesh hain aaj ke Playing XI...RCB beta...tumse na ho payega!" Ganesh tweeted, "Friendly banters are always welcome in cricket. But trolling isn't done. A new team calling a team which's been part of IPL since 2008 Beta...isn't banter. Kindly make amends."

174.title: Shanghai allows 4 mn people to leave their homes as COVID rules ease
174.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Wednesday allowed four million people out of their homes as coronavirus rules in the city eased. Almost 12 million people in the city of 25 million are now allowed to go outdoors following the first round of easing last week, an official said. Shanghai had put most of its population under lockdown on March 28.

175.title: BharatPe appoints Smriti Handa as Chief Human Resources Officer
175.article_body: BharatPe has appointed former Reckitt Global Talent Acquisition Director Smriti Handa as its Chief Human Resources Officer.
