Handa will work closely with the senior leadership team and focus on strengthening the organisational culture and HR practices, BharatPe said. Handa also held the position of Regional HR Director South Asia at Reckitt.

176.title: He's in jail, yet been named in FIR: Woman on son's name in MP clashes
176.article_body: Sakeena, mother of Shahbaz who has been named in FIR after violence that took place in Madhya Pradesh on Ram Navami, said that her son is already in jail and still has been named in the FIR. "It's being said...he's set motorcycles on fire and has pelted stones...How did he get out of jail to do all this?" she asked.

177.title: How Koreans will become a year younger with change in centuries-old counting method?
177.article_body: South Koreans will become a year younger as country's president-elect Yoon Suk-yeol is planning to abolish a centuries-old method of counting. South Koreans are labeled as one year old at birth and another year is added upon the New Year. The incoming administration is doing this in order to bring South Korea in line with rest of the world.

178.title: Uttarakhand government transfers 22 IAS officers
178.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami-led government transferred 22 Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officers. Former IPS Abhinav Kumar has retained his position as a Special Principal Secretary to the CM again. R Meenakshi Sundaram has been made Secretary to the CM. Radha Raturi has been given the Home Department in the state government.

179.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory again, ₹500 fine for violators
179.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Wednesday decided to make face masks mandatory again for citizens with a fine of ₹500 for violators. This comes after Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that a meeting has been scheduled with the experts and DDMA on April 20. Delhi on Tuesday reported 632 new cases of COVID-19.

180.title: When Kohli hits his straps, final piece of puzzle will be in place for RCB: Hogg
180.article_body: After RCB's win against LSG on Tuesday, former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said the Faf Du Plessis-led side is quickly becoming the favourites in the ongoing IPL season. "When Virat Kohli hits his straps...final piece of the puzzle will be in place for RCB," he added. So far, Kohli has scored 119 runs in their seven games.

181.title: Ukraine given more aircraft, spare parts: Pentagon
181.article_body: The US' Pentagon has said that the Ukrainian military has received additional aircraft and spare parts to repair the damaged ones to help them in their fight against Russia. Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby, however, did not reveal which countries provided the aircraft. Ukraine has more operable fighter planes than it had two weeks ago, he added.

182.title: After US and UK, Canada imposes sanctions on Putin’s daughters
182.article_body: Days after the US and the UK imposed sanctions against Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, Canada announced similar measures in view of the ongoing Ukraine war. The country in a statement said that it was imposing targeted sanctions against 14 persons connected with Russia, which included Putin's two adult daughters - Katerina Vladimirovna Tikhonova and Maria Vladimirovna Vorontsova.

183.title: Tamil Nadu govt plans to develop airport in Hosur industrial belt
183.article_body: Tamil Nadu government is planning to develop an airport in the industrial belt of Hosur, located about 40 km from Bengaluru. State Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu on Tuesday, said Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Ltd (TIDCO) has been directed to study the air traffic, market demand and other aspects. TIDCO will reportedly select a consultant for undertaking the study.

184.title: Demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri stops after SC steps in for 2nd time
184.article_body: The anti-encroachment drive has been stopped in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, said Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, Delhi Police. This comes after the Supreme Court ordered that authorities must be directed to stop the demolition drive. Earlier today, the Supreme Court had stayed the demolition drive, however, the demolition continued for about an hour after that.

185.title: My friend's mom said 'Your making-out scene was very good': Isha Talwar
185.article_body: Sharing the reactions to her performance in Rishi Kapoor-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actress Isha Talwar said, "My friend's mom messaged me saying that my making out scene was very good and that I look really sexy." "This is the best feedback I have got so far," added Isha. "It has been very sweet and...very heartwarming," stated Isha.

186.title: Met Mira 10 times before marriage; I still wonder 'how did it happen': Shahid
186.article_body: When asked how getting married to Mira Rajput changed him, Shahid Kapoor said, "Mine was an arranged marriage. It wasn't a love marriage or friends who've known each other for a long time choosing to settle and [living] their lives together." "We met...10 times before we got married...When I look back even I wonder, 'How did it happen?'" he added.

187.title: Contempt petition filed against Raut for levelling allegations against HC judges
187.article_body: Indian Bar Association has filed a contempt petition-cum-PIL against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and others for levelling "false, scandalous and contemptuous allegations" against judges of Bombay High Court in granting relief to BJP's Kirit Somaiya. The PIL also seeked action against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil and 'Saamana' Editor Rashmi Thackeray in the matter.

188.title: 'Heropanti 2' to feature the biggest action sequence ever filmed: Reports
188.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Nawazuddin Siddiqui's upcoming film 'Heropanti 2' will reportedly feature the "biggest" action sequence to have ever been filmed. "It took a heart of an action director to tarnish 10 deluxe Lamborghinis," said a source as quoted by the report. "We had to hire the most competent stunt trainers who could make the...process smoother," added the source.

189.title: Comedy films are accorded 2nd class status: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya
189.article_body: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya said comedy films are "accorded" second class status, adding that reviews of such movies do not accord the importance they deserve. "Audiences enjoyed the comedy in [my film] 'Idiot' so much that the theatres reverberated with the sound of clapping...But some media persons said that the film was not funny at all," stated Ravi.

190.title: Apple products had 20% recycled materials in 2021, highest-ever
190.article_body: Apple has revealed that nearly 20% of all material used in Apple products in 2021 was recycled, the highest-ever use of recycled content. For the first time ever for any Apple product, Apple used recycled gold in the main logic board in the iPhone 13 and iPhone13 Pro. Apple products in 2021 included 45% certified recycled rare earth elements.

191.title: Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran will be part of moral science in K'taka: Min
191.article_body: Moral science will be part of the curriculum from this academic year and won't just be restricted to one religion, the Karnataka Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh said. The essence of all religions including Panchatantra, Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran and others will be part of moral studies and there will be no exams on the subject, he said.

192.title: UPSC 2015 topper Tina Dabi to marry Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today
192.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, who topped Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) examination in 2015 is set to marry senior IAS officer Dr Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today. The marriage will reportedly take place at a five-star hotel in a private affair. According to reports, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has been invited to the wedding.

193.title: PBKS' Bairstow a big player but should get just 1 more game: Manjrekar
193.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said PBKS batter Jonny Bairstow is a "big" player with a good track record, but deserves just one more opportunity as batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa is in good form. Bairstow has scored 32 runs in three IPL 2022 matches so far for PBKS at a strike rate of 103.22. PBKS will take on DC today.

194.title: 22-yr-old run over by truck as bike skids on waterlogged road in B'luru
194.article_body: A 22-year-old man died as he was run over by a truck after his bike skidded on a waterlogged road in Bengaluru on Monday. His friend, who was the pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the accident. The mishap took place at Sampangiramnagar road near Corporation Circle when they were returning home from shopping after heavy rains.

195.title: Woke mind virus making Netflix unwatchable: Musk as Netflix loses members
195.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "The woke mind virus is making Netflix unwatchable." The tweet came after Netflix reported losing subscribers for the first time in more than 10 years. When a Twitter user said, "Not just Netflix. Movies in general, videogames, TV, they're all infested with current year trend woke garbage," Musk responded, "True".

196.title: Zoho's billionaire CEO shares pics of office made with mud/straw, says 'I love it so much'
196.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu took to Twitter to share pictures of his company's new conference room and small offices. He wrote, "New conference room and small offices, built with mud/straw and limestone cover, upstairs covered by thatched palm leaf. Comfortable even on a hot day." He added, "I love it so much I have made it my office!"

197.title: Ex-eBay exec to plead guilty to cyberstalking campaign against couple
197.article_body: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, will plead guilty to running a 2019 cyberstalking campaign against a couple who ran a website critical of eBay. Baugh is one of seven former eBay workers charged with harassing the couple behind the newsletter EcommerceBytes. Baugh's lawyers had requested a hearing for him to plead guilty on April 25.

198.title: Delhi records highest temperature in April in 11 years at 42.6°C: IMD
198.article_body: Delhi's Safdarjung observatory on Tuesday recorded a temperature of 42.6°C, the highest in April in the last 11 years, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. The all-time highest temperature on a day in April is 46.5°C which was recorded in 2010, as per IMD data. Eight stations in Delhi witnessed "a heatwave to severe heat conditions" on Tuesday, it added.

199.title: Taiwanese news channel falsely claims China has invaded Taiwan
199.article_body: A news channel in Taiwan falsely claimed that China had launched an invasion just outside the capital Taipei. Taipei-based Chinese Television Systems, a TV network partially owned by the Taiwanese government, ran a ticker along the bottom of the screen at 7 am local time on Wednesday. The station issued an apology live on air a few hours later.

200.title: Didn't get space in 'Vicky..' release, perhaps they don't like ugly faces : Annu
200.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor said that he felt let down by the producers for not giving him any space or promotion during the release of 'Vicky Donor'. "They just wanted to highlight and promote the hero...I have always faced this kind of partiality for a long time...Perhaps they don't like ugly faces like Annu Kapoor," he added.

201.title: Hotel owner gropes woman for objecting to unpalatable food in Mumbai, held
201.article_body: An owner of a Gorai-based hotel in Mumbai was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a social activist. The complainant, along with her daughter, had visited the Chinese food outlet on April 17. However, when she objected to the taste of the food, a verbal brawl erupted between the woman and the hotel owner who then allegedly groped her.

202.title: Masaba Gupta is the greatest designer and celeb ever: Sonam Kapoor
202.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor said on Instagram that fashion designer Masaba Gupta is the "greatest" designer and celeb ever, adding that she is "sucking up" to Masaba publicly as she can't wait for her baby bump clothes anymore. "She's...not made my baby bump clothes yet," stated Sonam. Discussing her pregnancy, Sonam had shared that she cannot sleep sometimes.

203.title: Chandigarh might bar unvaccinated kids from attending school
203.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Tuesday said they may bar unvaccinated kids from attending school amid the COVID-19 surge. "The unvaccinated children may be advised not to attend physical classes in the next few days," Chandigarh's health secretary Yashpal Garg said. "Though the anti-COVID vaccination is voluntary, it is worth mentioning that vaccines are safe for the children," he added.

204.title: Pune man sexually assaults teen whose mother considered him brother, held
204.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a 25-year-old man, Tejas Suresh Ahivale, for sexually assaulting a teenager whose mother reportedly considered him a brother. The accused allegedly assaulted the 14-year-old victim over five to six months and also threatened to kill her parents if she told anyone about it. The girl was later found to be four months pregnant.

205.title: With 6 wickets down, even big players can't deliver: Ajay Jadeja on PBKS
205.article_body: Talking about seventh-placed PBKS, ex-India player Ajay Jadeja said, "Once six wickets are down, even big players become no big." "PBKS have two solid openers and their 'go big' players are batting way behind," added Ajay. "[Batter] Shahrukh Khan is batting too low in the order. His talent needs to be utilised properly," stated Ajay.

206.title: Pic of ₹10 note with message 'Vishal, my wedding is on April 26, elope me' goes viral
206.article_body: A photo of ₹10 note with a message of a woman asking her lover to run away with her before her wedding has gone viral on Twitter. The woman wrote, "Vishal, my wedding is on April 26. Elope me. I love you. Your Kusum." A Twitter user wrote, "Tag all Vishals on this post. We will make them meet."

207.title: She is a new mother now: Anushka's brother on her quitting as a producer
207.article_body: Anushka Sharma and her brother Karnesh Sharma started Clean Slate Filmz together. Speaking about her decision to quit as a producer, her brother Karnesh said, "Clean Slate Filmz was started by her, so nobody can take that away." "Her priority...shifted...because producing is a 24/7 job and you can't expect her to do that as she's a mother now," he added.

208.title: Salah scores brace as Liverpool defeat Man Utd 4-0 to go top of EPL points table
208.article_body: Liverpool defeated Manchester United 4-0 to jump into the first spot on the Premier League points table. Liverpool's Luis Diaz scored the opening goal in the fifth minute of the game while Mohamed Salah made it 2-0 in the 22nd minute. Salah scored another in the second half along with Sadio Mane. United are placed sixth on points table.

209.title: Couple & their 5 kids asleep in hut burnt alive in house fire in Punjab
209.article_body: Seven members of a family were burnt alive as their hut caught fire on Wednesday morning in Punjab's Ludhiana. Police said that they were migrant labourers and were asleep in their hut near the municipal garbage dump yard on Tibba road. The victims include a couple and their five children.

210.title: Police bust cricket betting racket in Bengaluru, seize ₹1.93 lakh cash
210.article_body: Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police have busted a cricket betting racket and arrested the organiser. Police also seized ₹1.93 lakh cash and a mobile phone from the accused. "A case has been filed with Annapurneshwari Nagar Police, and further investigation is underway," the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said in a tweet on Wednesday.

211.title: Ludhiana chemist held with intoxicant pills, ₹1.65 lakh drug money
211.article_body: Ludhiana Rural Police’s CIA staff arrested a chemist with a cache of intoxicant pills, syrups and ₹1.65 lakh drug money on Monday. The accused had hidden the intoxicant pills at his house. Police have recovered 29,370 intoxicant pills and 35 syrups besides the drug money. The accused runs a chemist shop near Adda Raikot in Jagraon, a police official said.

212.title: No plan to impose fine for not wearing face masks in Delhi: Sisodia
212.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has said that the government is not planning to impose a fine for not wearing face masks in the national capital. "As of now, there is no need to panic as there are lower counts in the COVID-19 cases, and a meeting has been scheduled with the experts and DDMA on April 20," Sisodia added.

213.title: LSG's Marcus Stoinis screams 'F**k you' in anger after getting out, reprimanded
213.article_body: LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis was heard screaming 'F**k you' in anger after getting dismissed by RCB's Josh Hazlewood in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Stoinis was also seen gesturing angrily with his bat. Stoinis has been reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct. He admitted to Level 1 offence of IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction.

214.title: Woman from Delhi gangraped in moving autorickshaw in UP
214.article_body: A woman from Delhi was gangraped in a moving autorickshaw by its driver and his two accomplices in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh district. The accused also robbed the woman of her purse which contained ₹20,000. The woman, who came to Aligarh from Delhi via bus, alleged that the accused also thrashed her when she resisted the crime.

215.title: Centre approves 477 pesticides for drone usage to fast track agri-drone adoption
215.article_body: The central government has granted interim approval to 477 pesticides for drone usage to fast track agri-drone adoption, the Drone Federation of India said. Earlier, each pesticide had to be approved by CIB&RC which would take 18-24 months. It's a step towards reaching the vision of "one village one drone" in the next three years, DFI President Smit Shah said.

216.title: Police seize truck with 35 cattle in Assam's Biswanath, 5 arrested
216.article_body: Assam Police rescued 35 cattle from a truck in Assam's Biswanath district on Tuesday, officials said. Based on a tip-off, a team of Biswanath police had intercepted the truck, returning from the Laluk area of Assam's Lakhimpur, and arrested five persons on charges of animal cruelty. "A case has been registered in connection with it," Biswanath SP Navin Singh said.

217.title: KL Rahul breaches IPL Code of Conduct, fined 20% of match fee
217.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul has been fined 20% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's IPL 2022 match against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on Tuesday. Rahul admitted to the Level 1 offence of the IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction, the IPL said in a statement.

218.title: Father of UP boy killed in Canada seeks study loan waiver
218.article_body: The father of Kartik Vasudev, the student who was shot dead in Canada's Toronto days ago, has demanded the government to waive off the education loan he took for his son. "We mortgaged our house and ornaments to send him to Canada for MBA," said the father. He also demanded free education and a government job for his younger son.

219.title: Will hold Twitter board accountable over Musk's bid rejection: US governor
219.article_body: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has said the state will seek ways to hold Twitter's board "accountable" over the rejection of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy the platform. The state will hold the board "accountable for breaching their fiduciary duty", he said. "They rejected it because they know that they can't control Elon Musk," DeSantis said.

220.title: SC halts demolition in Delhi's violence-hit Jahangirpuri, orders status quo
220.article_body: Less than an hour after the bulldozers rolled in Jahangirpuri in New Delhi to begin an anti-encroachment drive, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said it would take up the matter for hearing tomorrow and ordered status quo till then. The demolition drive comes days after communal clashes broke out in the area in which at least nine policemen were injured.

221.title: Putin's executioners killed Ukrainian who shares my name: Navalny
221.article_body: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny accused Russian President Vladimir Putin's "executioners" of killing a 60-year-old man in Ukraine's Bucha because he shared the Navalny surname. "Apparently, they hoped he was my relative," he said. Navalny shared a picture on Twitter of a passport with the name Ilya Ivanovich Navalny that he said was deliberately left next to the dead body.

222.title: BJP leader held for putting saffron flag in Amravati leading to clash
222.article_body: Police have detained Abhay Matne, BJP’s Achalpur city unit chief and seven to eight persons from the party for allegedly putting up a saffron flag at Dulha Gate on Sunday. According to police, the act of hoisting saffron flag led to a clash between two communities following which a curfew was imposed in Amravati's Achalpur and its twin city Paratwada.

223.title: Youth surrenders for killing neighbour over verbal spat in Vadodara, held
223.article_body: A youth was arrested in Vadodara after he surrendered for allegedly murdering his 47-year-old neighbour in the Danteshwar area of the city. On Tuesday, the deceased got involved in a verbal spat with the accused, according to the police. The deceased allegedly verbally abused the accused’s mother and sister, provoking him to attack, police said.

224.title: North Delhi civic body conducts anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri
224.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation has started conducting an anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri. The drive will be done on illegal construction in the area on April 20 and 21. The civic body has asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to maintain the law and order situation during the drive. North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani inspected the area on Wednesday morning.

225.title: Asha remembers sister Lata Mangeshkar on 'Dance...', says 'She's still with me'
225.article_body: In the upcoming episode of 'Dance India Dance Little Masters', singer Asha Bhosle will appear as a guest judge. The channel shared a promo from the upcoming episode, in which two contestants performed imitating Asha and her late sister, singer Lata Mangeshkar. Their performance left Asha Bhosle in tears. She said, "My sister...left this world but she's still with me."

226.title: We're methodically carrying out our plan in eastern Ukraine: Russia
226.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said Russian forces are "methodically carrying out" plans to "liberate" two breakaway regions, Donetsk and Luhansk, in eastern Ukraine. The US and West are trying to prolong Moscow's military operation, he said, adding, "The increasing volume of foreign arms supplies...shows their intentions to provoke the Kyiv regime to fight to the last Ukrainian standing."

227.title: Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC: Manjrekar
227.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC in their upcoming games. "Pant hasn't fired completely...Both Shaw and Warner are high-risk players and there might be a problem if DC lose a couple of early wickets," he explained. So far, Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in their five games.

228.title: BJP has declared war, is punishing Muslims for daring to stay alive: Owaisi
228.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to say that the Bharatiya Janata Party has declared war against the poorest. "In the name of encroachment it's going to destroy homes in Delhi like UP & MP. No notice, no opportunity to go to court...simply punishing poor Muslims for daring to stay alive...@ArvindKejriwal must clarify his dubious role," the tweet read.

229.title: 1,900 sites inspected for anti-open burning campaign in Delhi: Govt
229.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Tuesday said the government had so far inspected 1,915 sites as part of its anti-open burning campaign. Further, a total of 21 notices or challans have also been issued to violators, he added. The minister said that a high-level meeting to solve Delhi's landfill fire problem will be held on April 21.

230.title: Sidharth Malhotra joins Rohit Shetty's cop universe, shares first picture
230.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra will now be a part of filmmaker Rohit Shetty's cop universe. Sharing a glimpse of his look on Instagram, Sidharth wrote, "Rohit Shetty's cop universe goes digital tomorrow at 11 AM!" Rohit also shared the post and wrote, "Action begins tomorrow." Actor Anupam Kher wished him luck and commented on the picture, "Good luck, my friend!"

231.title: Nazara to acquire 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for ₹10 cr
231.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed gaming platform Nazara Technologies' arm Nodwin Gaming's board has approved the acquisition of 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for around ₹10 crore. Nazara has also invested in gaming accessories brand Wings, which designs and deals in high-quality and affordable gaming audio gear. Earlier, Nazara announced it will be investing ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures.

232.title: UP couple injured in blast in J&K's Rajouri
232.article_body: A married couple from Uttar Pradesh sustained injuries after what the police are calling a "mysterious explosion" took place near a slum in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Tuesday. The victims were identified as 25-year-old Vinod Kumar and 20-year-old Kranti Devi. The two were said to be stable after being hospitalised, according to police.

233.title: 6 TRS leaders held in mother-son suicide case in Telangana
233.article_body: At least six leaders of Telangana's ruling party Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), including Ramayampet Municipal Chairman Palle Jitender Goud, were arrested in a mother-son suicide case. They were accused of abetting the suicide of a real estate businessman and his mother in Kamareddy, police said. The victims had set themselves ablaze, accusing TRS leaders and a circle inspector of harassment.

234.title: 2 terror accused met Pak Army Major seen in pic with IAF pilot Abhinandan: Delhi Police
234.article_body: Two men arrested by Delhi Police on terror charges have allegedly identified a Pakistani Army Major whom they had met while undergoing training by ISI in Pakistan. They identified "Major Hamza" from a photograph shown of IAF Group Captain Abhinandan Varthaman who was in Pakistani custody for a brief spell three years ago, according to a chargesheet filed in court.

235.title: Rainfall, thunderstorm predicted in several states; list released
235.article_body: The IMD has predicted fairly widespread rainfall over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Sikkim, and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal during the next four days. Under the influence of a Western Disturbance, light isolated rainfall with thunderstorms, lightning, gusty winds likely over Punjab and Haryana, and Delhi on April 20 and 21.

236.title: Russian army is most barbaric and inhuman: Ukraine Prez
236.article_body: The Russian army is writing itself into history forever as the most barbaric and inhuman army in the world, said Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "They have driven almost everyone and everything that is capable of fighting us against Ukraine," he said in a video address to his country. The Russians are not allowing humanitarian corridors, he added.

237.title: Bodies of Nepalese woman, infant found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari
237.article_body: The bodies of a Nepalese woman and her nine-month-old child were found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari village, the police said. The woman's husband found the bodies when he returned from work and took down the bodies before the arrival of the police. The family is originally from Nepal and worked in an apple orchard in Shimla.

238.title: Actor Ezra Miller throws chair at woman, arrested for second-degree assault
238.article_body: Days after being arrested on charges of disorderly conduct and harassment at a bar in Hawaii, actor Ezra Miller, who portrayed The Flash in DC's 'Justice League', was arrested again for a second-degree assault. Miller was arrested after he threw a chair at a 26-year-old woman on being asked to leave a get-together. Police are investigating the matter.

239.title: It took 10 years: Taapsee on working with Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki'
239.article_body: Speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani in 'Dunki', Taapsee Pannu took to Twitter to share her excitement. She wrote, "A superstar once said...'When you wish for something with all your heart...entire universe conspires to get it for you.' Cheers to honesty, hard work and perseverance. It took 10 years but finally 'All is Well'."

240.title: Dad started work at 15, left house with ₹20; mom restarted career at 56: Karan
240.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra said that he is privileged because his father started working at the age of 15 and left house with ₹20. Karan added that his mother restarted her career as a registered nurse in the US. "When parents got married, my dad went back to his Air Force base and mom went to her hostel," he further said.

241.title: Govt to run check on those coming for Char Dham Yatra: U'khand CM
241.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said those coming to the state on Char Dham Yatra will have to undergo proper verification so that those who may pose a threat to peace are kept out. "Our state is a peaceful state...Those doing riots, creating enmity or spreading hate in the name of religion do not have any place here," Dhami stated.

242.title: The bounce was unreal with the new ball: Hazlewood on 4/25 vs LSG
242.article_body: RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood said the bounce was unreal at the DY Patil Stadium and it helped him to create opportunities to take wickets in the first few overs against LSG. "If you get it right you can create opportunities...We have got a well-rounded bowling attack," he added. Hazlewood picked four wickets, conceding 25 runs in the game.

243.title: Maha seeks removal of 22 social media accounts with 'communal disharmony posts'
243.article_body: The Maharashtra Cyber Cell has proposed to block 22 social media accounts for "propagating communal disharmony" in the wake of communal clashes incidents reported in some states. On observing the current atmosphere (of the country), 48 police stations under the department are actively filtering out accounts that post objectionable and defamatory content, a senior police officer said.

244.title: Man dies in police custody in Bhubaneswar, 2 women claim body
244.article_body: A man, identified as Pradip Sahu by the police who was caught in a cycle theft case, died in police custody in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, officials said. A woman claimed that the man was not Sahu but her husband, Devendra Choudhary. Notably, another woman also reached the police station to claim the man's body and said that he is her husband.

245.title: Elon Musk willing to invest up to $15 billion of own money to buy Twitter: Report
245.article_body: Elon Musk is willing to invest between $10 billion and $15 billion of his own money to take Twitter Inc private, the New York Post reported citing two sources. The Tesla CEO and world's richest man, who is Twitter's second-biggest shareholder with a 9.1% stake, is planning to launch an offer in about 10 days, the report added.

246.title: Hopefully a hundred is around the corner: Du Plessis on 96(64) vs LSG
246.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, who scored 96(64) runs against LSG, said someone had to stabilise their innings after they lost two early wickets and he's grateful that he could do that. He added that he has scored a few fifty-plus scores now and "hopefully (a ton) is around the corner". Earlier, Plessis scored 88 in their match against PBKS.

247.title: Pups bit Arnav with sharp teeth, it was bleeding: Arun Vijay on Oh My Dog
247.article_body: Actor Arun Vijay said that pups started biting his on and off screen son Arnav Vijay with "sharp teeth" during shoot of 'Oh My Dog'. "He handled it so well...He had no problems with scratches on his hands...it was bleeding...He just put on some sanitiser and then he just went and started doing it again...because he loves dogs," Arun added.

248.title: 50 tonnes of raw material gutted as fire breaks out in Ahmedabad godown
248.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of industrial raw material was gutted in a fire that broke out at Kapsun Resource Corp company's godown in an industrial area near Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Tuesday. The company manufactures industrial water coolers. "Nine water tankers, one fire fighting tanker...over 40 firefighting personnel were rushed to the spot," an official said. No casualty or injury was reported.

249.title: RSS, PFI should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest: CPI(M) leader
249.article_body: CPI(M) Kerala State Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan said that ban on communal outfits was not a solution to check the growing "communal virus" in the country. Speaking about RSS and SDPI workers' killings in Palakkad, he said that the crimes were well-planned. "Both, RSS and PFI, should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest," Balakrishnan added.

250.title: German park renames boar called Putin over Ukraine war
250.article_body: A wild boar, named Putin after the Russian President, got a new name after the authorities at a German animal park decided that the old one was getting uncomfortable following the start of the Ukraine war. After an online poll, the animal, a purebred Russian hog, was renamed as "Eberhofer". Ukrainian names such as Zelenskyy and Klitschko were also suggested.

251.title: A narrative of fine fabrics hand-stitched to perfection: Raymond
251.article_body:
Raymond announced that as India's leading men's fashion brand, it has introduced a fascinating line of fine fabrics to create delightful silhouettes for various celebratory occasions. 
The moments of joy with family deserve an immaculately stylised wardrobe, the brand stated, adding that every fabric from this collection is hand-stitched to perfection, thus making precious moments truly memorable.

252.title: Life on Mars will not be luxurious, it will be difficult: Elon Musk
252.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in an interview with TED head Chris Anderson discussed life on Mars, saying that life there "will not be luxurious", especially in the beginning. "The sales pitch for going to Mars is, 'It's dangerous, it's cramped. You might not make it back. It's difficult, it's hard work,'" Musk said.

253.title: India sees 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, over 65% rise in daily cases
253.article_body: India has reported 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, 1,547 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 1,247 cases and one death. Active COVID-19 cases in India rose to 12,340, while the death toll reached 5,22,006.

254.title: Which bowlers have dismissed Virat Kohli for golden duck in IPL history?
254.article_body: Virat Kohli on Tuesday got out for a golden duck for the fourth time in IPL. Kohli was dismissed by LSG's Dushmantha Chameera. Kohli's first golden duck in IPL came against MI on May 28, 2008, when he was dismissed by Ashish Nehra. Sandeep Sharma and Nathan Coulter-Nile got Kohli out for a first-ball duck in 2014 and 2017, respectively.

255.title: DCP inspects Jahangirpuri area ahead of anti-encroachment drive
255.article_body: Delhi's North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani on Wednesday morning inspected the Jahangirpuri area ahead of the anti-encroachment drive announced by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). This comes after MCD asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to handle law and order during the drive. The drive will be done on illegal construction in Jahangirpuri on April 20 and 21.

256.title: 26-year-old man arrested in Pune for murder of 8-year-old child
256.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested for the murder of an eight-year-old child in Pune. The child was reported missing on Sunday and was later found in an unused accommodation a few metres from his house. Police said, "The reports about attempted sexual assault are untrue [and] so far, the motive appears to be money, but it cannot be confirmed."

257.title: No innocent person should be booked in Jahangirpuri violence: Minorities panel
257.article_body: A National Commission for Minorities delegation led by Chairperson Iqbal Singh Lalpura visited Delhi’s violence-hit Jahangirpuri area. The delegation called upon the administration to ensure that no innocent person is booked in the matter and requested to quickly nab the culprits involved in the violence. The delegation took stock of the situation from DCP North West.

258.title: Anupam Kher meets The Great Khali in Delhi, shares pic of himself standing on chair
258.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with former WWE wrestler The Great Khali. Sharing a picture of himself standing on a chair alongside The Great Khali, Anupam wrote on Instagram, "The only way one can be taller than The Great Khali is [this]." "That's a great formula," a user commented on the picture.

259.title: Jahangirpuri arms supplier arrested after encounter, has over 60 cases: Delhi Police
259.article_body: An arms supplier from Delhi's Jahangirpuri area has been nabbed after a brief encounter in which he was injured, said DCP Outer North Brijendra Yadav to ANI on Wednesday. According to DCP Yadav, he is named in more than 60 previous cases. Nine policemen and a civilian were injured in clashes during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday.

260.title: Russian forces steal Ukraine man's AirPods, he uses them to track their movement
260.article_body: A Ukrainian man has been tracking the redeployment of Russia forces via AirPods stolen from him by invading troops. Vitaliy Semenets' AirPods were looted from his home in Hostomel, near Kyiv, soon after the war began as Russia tried to take the Ukrainian capital. He has since been using Find My app to track the movement of Russian forces.

261.title: Can't get out of bed sometimes; it gets difficult: Sonam on pregnancy
261.article_body: Speaking about her pregnancy, actress Sonam Kapoor said her sleep pattern has got disrupted and that she's unable to fulfil her work obligation. "No one warns you how difficult it'll be, but it'll be difficult," she added. "I can't sleep sometimes...I'm...an early riser and it was like [it's] 8:30 AM and I just couldn't get out of bed," Sonam said.

262.title: 11 yrs ago, Adi said look test was my world cup final's penalty kick: Ranveer
262.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh recalled his 'Band Baaja Baaraat' look test that happened 11 years ago. "Adi sir (Aditya Chopra) had told me that this is my world cup final's penalty kick. [He said] 'If you score in this, you are a champion and if not, you can go back home'. Right here. What a moment to remember," he added.

263.title: B'luru records excess rainfall of 151 mm since Mar 1, to receive more showers
263.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Tuesday said Bengaluru would continue to receive scattered rainfall for the next few days. Maximum and minimum temperatures are likely to be around 33°C and 21°C for the next two days, IMD predicted. Bengaluru has recorded 151 mm rainfall from March 1 to April 19, it added, saying, "The city has received excess rainfall so far."

264.title: 72% Mumbai mosques complying with noise rules: Police
264.article_body: Nearly 72 percent of mosques in Mumbai are complying with noise pollution rules and have either stopped using loudspeakers or are keeping their sound very low during azaan, as per Mumbai Police's survey. People have started sending applications seeking permission to use loudspeakers but permission will be granted only if it meets all security parameters, a police officer said.

265.title: Stopped publishing bulletin, sending mails: Kerala Health Min on COVID data
265.article_body: Allegations that Kerala is not giving COVID-19 data to the Centre are absolutely wrong, state Health Minister Veena George said. "We've stopped publishing daily bulletin in the state...have been sending mails," she added. "It's quite unfortunate...a responsible person from Union government is sending letter to Principal Secretary stating that Kerala is not giving data to the Centre," Veena stated.

266.title: Centre’s regressive policies dampening farm sector growth: KCR
266.article_body: Calling the Centre's policies on agriculture regressive, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday said that they are dampening the growth of the farm sector in the country. He said that the policies would reduce output instead of boosting it. His remarks came in a meeting with the state Agriculture Minister and officials to assess preparedness for rainy season crops.

267.title: Bodies of man, woman tied together by waist found in Narmada canal in Guj
267.article_body: The bodies of a man and woman were recovered from Narmada main canal near Gadit village in Gujarat's Halol. Police said they haven't been identified yet as no evidence was found on them. "It appears to be a prima facie case of...suicide," police added. The bodies were first spotted near Rameshra but were swept away towards Halol with the current.

268.title: Mumbai to witness high tides on 22 days this monsoon season: BMC
268.article_body: Mumbai will witness 22 days of high tide in four months of monsoon this year, according to BMC's Disaster Management Authority. High tides will occur on six days each in June and July and five days each in August and September, the data showed. The highest tide of 4.87 metres is expected on one day each in June and July.

269.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass to fully open to public on April 24
269.article_body: The 750-metre-long Ashram underpass in Delhi will be fully open to the public from April 24. The underpass, connecting central and south Delhi, will be inaugurated by Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday. "At present, traffic movement is allowed till 11 pm. Once the underpass is officially inaugurated, it will be open [throughout] the day." a PWD official said.

270.title: Aus scientists to power Tesla on 15,000-km trip with printed solar panels
270.article_body: Australian scientists will test using printed solar panels to run a Tesla on a 15,100-kilometre journey beginning in September. The team will use 18 of its printed plastic solar panels, each 18 metres (59 feet) long. They will roll out the panels beside the car to absorb sunlight when the car will be in need of a charge.

271.title: Posing as customers, 3 women, 1 man steal gold earrings & pendants in Punjab
271.article_body: Three women and one man allegedly stole two pairs of gold earrings and two pendants from jewellery shop in Ludhiana while posing as customers. Fraudsters allegedly engaged jeweller in conversation and also sent his employee to fetch water for them. They asked owner to show nose rings and earrings and pretended to not like anything before leaving with stolen jewellery.

272.title: Could've done better with bowling, RCB's 181 was 15-20 extra runs: Rahul
272.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul said they could've done better as they lost by 18 runs against RCB on Tuesday. "We started really well after getting two wickets in the first over...but [RCB's 181-run total] on [this] pitch was 15-20 extra runs we gave away...we couldn't really squeeze in the middle and with the bat as well," he added.

273.title: Bombay HC judge recuses from Elgar case, third to do so this year
273.article_body: Bombay High Court Justice Sadhana S Jadhav recused herself from hearing pleas related to the Bhima Koregaon-Elgar Parishad case in which several writers and activists are accused. Jadhav is the third judge to do so this year after Justice Prasanna B Varale and Justice S S Shinde recused themselves from hearing pleas related to the case.

274.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised cricket betting racket, 4 arrested
274.article_body: Hyderabad City Police busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested four people. They seized seven cell phones, a TV with a setup box and remotes, one calculator, one notebook, one pen and ₹2.80 lakh in cash. A raid was conducted when the accused were running cricket betting in an organised manner in Venkateshwar Nagar, police said.

275.title: Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar; gets his personal chef to cook for them
275.article_body: Ram Charan, who is currently shooting for filmmaker Shankar's yet-to-be-titled upcoming film, spent the afternoon with the soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) in Khasa, Amritsar. Reportedly, Ram brought his personal chef to cook meal for all the soldiers on the campus. Sharing the pictures from the Amritsar's BSF campus, Ram wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories."

276.title: Ajay pranked crew during Runway 34's shoot; added Bhang in lassi: Hrishikesh
276.article_body: Actor Hrishikesh Pandey, who'll be seen in 'Runway 34', spoke about working with actor-director Ajay Devgn in the film. He said, "I wasn't expecting him to be so sweet...and wonderful. I thought he'd be stern and cut to cut." "Ajay sir is known as a prankster. On April Fool's Day, he added bhang in lassi, which everyone had," Hrishikesh added.

277.title: Wrote comedy on arrest, jokes came to mind as I reached police station: Munawar
277.article_body: Comedian and 'Lock Upp' contestant Munawar Faruqui said that he started writing his new comedy special on his arrest when he went to jail. "Jokes had started coming to my mind...when I reached the police station...I was in a very very bad condition...They were the worst days of my life...I was observing everything...and writing jokes about them," he added.

278.title: Indian Air Force successfully test fires BrahMos missile from Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet
278.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Tuesday successfully test-fired a BrahMos supersonic cruise missile from a Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet on the Eastern seaboard. The "live firing" of the missile was carried out in close coordination with the Indian Navy, the IAF said. The missile hit the target, a decommissioned Indian Navy ship, with accuracy and precision, officials said.

279.title: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 cr in liquor revenue in 2021-22, 3rd highest in UP
279.article_body: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 crore in liquor revenue in financial year 2021-22 which was the third-highest in UP behind Lucknow and Kanpur, excise department officials said. Ghaziabad residents consumed over 2.88 crore bottles of beer and over 1.30 crore bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor. "Revenue earned from liquor in 2021-22 has been the highest in five years," an official said.

280.title: 2 contract killers arrested in murder of 25-year-old man in Thane
280.article_body: Police have arrested two contract killers in the murder of a 25-year-old man in Thane. According to police, the deceased, identified as Mangesh Patil, had become a hurdle for his three relatives on their ancestral property issues in the Shil-Daighar area. Therefore, in order to get Patil killed, his relatives gave a contract of ₹50,000 to the killers, police added.

281.title: CSK players attend Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire, pics surface
281.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) contingent attended New Zealand batter Devon Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire in Mumbai's Trident Hotel. "Honestly a night I’ll never forget! Thank you so much to the CSK family for a lovely evening! Now onto the big day ahead," Conway wrote on Instagram. Conway and his longtime girlfriend Kim had got engaged in 2020.

282.title: Maria Sharapova pregnant with first child, shares pic of baby bump
282.article_body: Ex-world number one women's tennis player Maria Sharapova has announced that she's pregnant with her first child. Sharapova, who turned 35 on Tuesday, shared a picture of her baby bump on Instagram, writing, "Precious beginnings...Eating birthday cake for two has always been my specialty." The five-time Grand Slam champion got engaged to UK art dealer Alexander Gilkes in December 2020.

283.title: Netflix loses subscribers for 1st time in more than 10 years
283.article_body: The number of Netflix subscribers has fallen for the first time in more than a decade. The streaming company lost 200,000 members in the first three months of the year, the company said on Tuesday. Netflix's shares, already down more than 40% this year, tumbled as much as 27% to $256 in after-hours trading.

284.title: RCB go 2nd on IPL 2022 points table with 18-run win against LSG
284.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 18 runs to register their second win in a row. With this, RCB jumped to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table, while LSG have dropped to the fourth position. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored in the match with 96(64), while Josh Hazlewood took four wickets.

285.title: 2 ex-business partners get into a fight, injured in shootout in WB
285.article_body: Two former business partners were injured in a shootout in West Bengal's Kolkata at Brahmapur area. Locals claimed it was the fallout of a TMC syndicate fight. However, the local councillor said, "There was personal enmity between the two and the firing took place due to personal problems."

286.title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Philippines' Mindanao island
286.article_body: The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) on Tuesday said a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Mindanao island in the Philippines. No injuries or damage have been reported so far. The EMSC said the quake was recorded at a depth of 10 km. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said aftershocks and damage are expected following the earthquake.

287.title: Captain of large Russian landing ship killed in Ukraine: Reports
287.article_body: The captain of a large Russian landing ship has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Governor of Sevastopol Mikhail Razvozhayev said Captain Alexander Chirva died from wounds he sustained during a battle with Ukrainian defenders. Captain Chirva was the commander of the Russian landing ship Caesar Kunikov which is a part of Russia's Black Sea fleet.

288.title: Maharashtra reports 137 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
288.article_body: Maharashtra, on Tuesday, logged 137 new COVID-19 cases taking its tally to 78,76,041, the latest health department bulletin showed. There were three casualties reported as well, pushing the overall death tally to 1,47,830, according to the bulletin. Out of three new deaths in Maharashtra, Pune accounted for two deaths while Parbhani saw a single fatality.

289.title: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
289.article_body: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years and the Ukraine war further caused a rise in costs, he added.

290.title: Live-in relationships are leading to rise in sexual offences: MP High Court
290.article_body: The "bane of live-in relationship", a "byproduct" of rights conferred under Article 21 of the Constitution, is leading to a rise in sexual offences, Madhya Pradesh High Court said. It made the observation while rejecting anticipatory bail plea of a man accused of raping a woman. The complainant got pregnant and underwent abortions under pressure from her then partner.

291.title: Assam authorities alert districts to be prepared to tackle floods
291.article_body: The government of Assam has started the preparations to deal with the flood situation and alerted all the districts to be ready as well. "We have identified locations based on the last 10 years' flood data [and]...identified 11 circles that are spread over five districts that receive floods almost every year," CEO of Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

292.title: Odisha CM Patnaik sanctions ₹120 cr for Kendu leaf pluckers
292.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹120 crore for bonus and other allowances for Kendu leaf pluckers and other seasonal workers. A statement from the Chief Minister's office said, "It will benefit around 8 lakh Kendu leaf pluckers, binders and other seasonal staff." The state government also decided to increase the collection price of Kendu leaf for 2022.

293.title: US President Joe Biden should come to Ukraine: President Zelenskyy
293.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US President Joe Biden "should come" to visit Ukraine. "It's his decision of course and they must consider the safety situation. But I think he's the leader of the United States and that's why he should come here to see," Zelenskyy said. The White House has since stated Biden has "no plans" to visit Ukraine.

294.title: MHA designates LeT commander Sheikh Sajad as terrorist under UAPA
294.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs designated Sheikh Sajad, a commander of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), as a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The ministry stated in a notification that Sajad has been absconding in a case related to the recovery of arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir. He has also been recruiting the youth of J&K into LeT.

295.title: Sri Lankan PM offers to hold talks with anti-govt protesters
295.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday offered to hold talks with anti-government protesters amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Earlier, the protesters had said that they would only leave if PM Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa step down. Notably, the opposition has threatened to bring a no-confidence motion against the government over its handling of the crisis.

296.title: Electric chopsticks that can make food taste saltier developed in Japan
296.article_body: Researchers in Japan claim that they have developed computerised chopsticks that can make food taste saltier, in a "world first". Co-developed by Meiji University professor Homei Miyashita and beverage maker Kirin Holdings, the device uses electrical stimulation and is attached to a mini wristband computer. The chopsticks can potentially help people reduce their salt intake, the researchers said.

297.title: He was the cement that build RCB innings: Jaffer on Du Plessis' 96 vs LSG
297.article_body: After RCB captain Faf du Plessis' 64-ball 96 helped his side post 181/6 in 20 overs against LSG in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "From 21*(20) to 50*(40) to 96(64). Faf was the cement that build RCB innings." He added, "Masterclass in how to rebuild after an early collapse." RCB were reduced to 7/2 after the first over.

298.title: Cong isn't dead, will play role of constructive opp'n in Punjab: Sidhu
298.article_body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu, while speaking about the party's loss in the state Assembly elections this year, said that the "Congress party has lost but isn't dead". He added that Congress will be playing the role of a constructive opposition in Punjab and that they will "work to provide the solution to the problems of people".

299.title: 12 states face power crisis due to coal shortage: Maha Minister
299.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that 12 states are facing electricity issues due to the shortage of coal and that his department was working to mitigate the shortage. "Shortage is also due to lack of rakes (trains). We require 37 rakes per day, while we get only 26. Each rake can transport 4,000 metric tonnes of coal," Raut said.

300.title: Hubballi rioters will be tried as per existing law: Karnataka CM
300.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has said that those involved in the Hubballi riots will be tried as per the existing laws in the state. "When riots took place in Uttar Pradesh, certain action was taken according to the situation prevailing over there. We are reviewing the situation in Karnataka. We will go by our law," Bommai said.

301.title: Ayodhya's security increased along with Ram Temple: Report
301.article_body: Ahead of the final stage of completion of the plinth at the Ram Temple, the security in Ayodhya has been reportedly increased. Entire city has been reportedly kept under the surveillance of CCTV cameras and soldiers have been deployed on watchtowers to monitor people. According to the report, the city will also get a new control room for security.

302.title: 22-yr-old techie's laptop catches fire in Andhra, she suffers 80% burns
302.article_body: A 22-year-old software engineer from Andhra Pradesh suffered around 80% burns after the laptop she was working on triggered a fire, police said. The incident took place on Monday when sparks from Sumalatha's laptop, which was being charged, caused a fire that spread rapidly in her room. As per a preliminary probe, the fire originated from the laptop's charger adapter.

303.title: PM Modi shares pic after meeting Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh; Poland reacts
303.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh in Gujarat's Jamnagar and wrote, "The goodwill of Jam Saheb's family is spread all over the world, especially in Europe." Responding to his tweet, Poland's envoy Adam Burakowski tweeted, "PM of India...visited Jam Saheb, son of Jam Saheb Digvijay Sinhji who during II World War hosted c.a. 800 Polish children in Balachadi."

304.title: ₹2.58 lakh crore wiped off HDFC & HDFC Bank's market value in 9-day sell-off
304.article_body: As much as ₹2.58 lakh crore has been wiped out of the combined market value of HDFC Ltd and HDFC Bank in a nine-day sell-off. The development comes after the two companies announced their merger earlier this month. HDFC Ltd, which was among India's top 10 most valuable companies prior to the announcement, is no longer on the list.

305.title: Anguished by the tragic accident in Jhunjhunu: PM Narendra Modi
305.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish and offered condolences over the road accident in Jhunjhunu, Rajasthan, where 11 members of a family were killed and several others injured after a jeep rammed into a tractor trolley. PM Modi tweeted, "₹2 lakh each from PMNRF would be given to the next of family of the deceased. The injured would be given ₹50,000."

306.title: No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody in India: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
306.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her US visit on Monday said, "No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody (in India)." She said, "The one big step the government decided was we shall not tax people to get out of the pandemic." Calling the building of infrastructure "best multiplier for economic recovery", she added, "Capital expenditure was our route to recovery."

307.title: UK PM apologises for attending surprise b'day party amid lockdown after being fined
307.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has offered an apology for attending illegal party during lockdown, but said he didn't knowingly break rules or mislead Parliament. Johnson told lawmakers that "it did not occur to me" that the gathering was a party. Last week, Johnson was fined £50 for attending his own surprise birthday party at his official residence in June 2020.

308.title: UN chief calls for 4-day pause to fighting in Ukraine
308.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has called for a four-day "humanitarian pause to the war in Ukraine" ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday. "The onslaught and terrible toll on civilians we've seen so far could pale in comparison to the horror that lies ahead. This cannot be allowed to happen," he said. The war has sparked a humanitarian crisis in Ukraine.

309.title: 5 grenades, 10 pistols among the arms recovered from J&K's Kupwara
309.article_body: A huge cache of arms and ammunition was reportedly recovered from Kupwara district during a search operation conducted by the police along with the Indian Army. Ten pistols, 17 pistol magazines, 54 pistol rounds and five grenades were seized, the police said. On Sunday, the J&K police along with the Army arrested a suspected terrorist and seized ammunition from him.

310.title: My parents love that I am wearing a uniform in 'Runway 34': Rakul
310.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that her parents "love" that she is wearing a uniform in her upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "I have grown up with people in uniform around me," she stated. Rakul added her father gives her critical reviews of her films. "For me, they (her parents) are the public; I get..best reviews from them," Rakul said.

311.title: 23-year-old Mumbai student arrested for selling child pornography
311.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Mumbai was arrested for collecting child pornographic materials, which he sold via the messaging application Telegram, the police said. The Maharashtra cyber-police department had registered an FIR on April 5, after a complaint from an activist who reported it to the police. The accused has been booked under the Information Technology Act, they added.

312.title: Virat Kohli goes 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred
312.article_body: India and RCB batter Virat Kohli has now gone 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred. Kohli, who got out for a golden duck against LSG today, has played 17 Tests, 21 ODIs, 25 T20Is and 37 IPL matches since scoring his previous hundred in November 2019. Kohli's previous hundred came in a Test against Bangladesh.

313.title: Actor Bob Odenkirk honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star
313.article_body: Actor Bob Odenkirk has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. Jonathan Banks, Patrick Fabian, Tony Dalton, Giancarlo Esposito, Patrick Fabian, and Michael Mando attended the ceremony. The actor is known for his work in 'Breaking Bad', 'Better Call Saul'. Bob's star was placed next to Bryan Cranston, who was Bob's co-star in 'Breaking Bad'.

314.title: Ukraine denies attacking Russian border village amid ongoing war
314.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday denied accusations by a Russian provincial governor that it had attacked a border village amid countries' ongoing conflict. Vyacheslav Gladkov, Governor of Russian province of Belgorod had accused Ukrainian forces of wounding three people and damaging as many as 30 houses in alleged attack. "Ukraine is conducting a defence operation on its territory," Ukrainian military said.

315.title: Greece impounds oil tanker as part of EU sanctions against Russia
315.article_body: Greece on Tuesday said that it has impounded a Russian oil tanker off the island of Evia. The move is part of efforts by Greece to enforce European Union (EU) sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Earlier this month, the EU had banned Russian-flagged vessels from its ports with some exemptions.

316.title: RCB can make it to the top-four in IPL 2022: Jaffer
316.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said RCB have the team to make it to the top four in IPL 2022. "Form of Dinesh Karthik has been excellent, Glenn Maxwell has come back to form...Shahbaz Ahamad has been playing sensible cricket," he added. Jaffer further said that RCB's bowling looks settled with the presence of Josh Hazlewood and Harshal Patel.

317.title: BSF recovers 2.1 kg of suspected heroin near border in Punjab
317.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) in Punjab's Amritsar sector on Tuesday recovered four packets containing 2.1 kg of suspected heroin along with a pistol, a magazine and 37 Rds. Sharing a picture of the items on Twitter, Punjab Frontier BSF wrote that the recovery was made by the troops while "monitoring harvesting activities of farmers ahead of border fence".

318.title: Oil drops below the $110 mark after IMF cuts global growth forecast
318.article_body: Oil price dipped below the $110 mark on Tuesday after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reduced its global growth forecast and warned of higher inflation. Brent crude fell $3.94 to $109.22/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $3.8 to $104.41/barrel. IMF had said growth in emerging markets and developed economies could reduce by 1.3% and 0.9% over three years.

319.title: LSG skipper KL Rahul has improved his leadership qualities: Jaffer
319.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul, who previously led PBKS in IPL, Wasim Jaffer said the LSG captain's leadership is getting better with time. "I had been involved with Punjab team in the last two years and think he's a phenomenal player and has scored runs against all teams," he added. LSG are currently third on points table in IPL 2022.

320.title: He touched our hearts: PM Modi after WHO chief greets public in Gujarati
320.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has thanked WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus for speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English during an inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Jamnagar. PM Modi said, "[Tedros] made us feel 'Triveni'...and touched our hearts by speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English." Tedros had greeted public asking, "Kem cho? Majama? (How're you? Fine?)"

321.title: 13,964 posts removed due to increasing communal tension: Mumbai Police
321.article_body: Around 13,964 social media posts have been deleted in the last four months due to an increase in communal tension and violence in the country, the Mumbai Police said. The special branch of Mumbai Police deleted 5,754 posts in January, 4,252 posts in February and 3,958 social media posts in March.

322.title: Russia expels 15 Dutch envoys in retaliatory move amid Ukraine war
322.article_body: Russia on Tuesday expelled 15 Dutch diplomats from the country, its Foreign Ministry said. Among those expelled, 14 persons were employees at the Dutch embassy in Moscow and one was a staffer at the Dutch Consulate General in St. Petersburg. The move comes in response to the expulsion of 17 Russian envoys in the Netherlands last month amid Ukraine invasion.

323.title: Centre writes to 4 states & Delhi amid rise in COVID-19 cases, positivity rate
323.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Maharashtra and Mizoram on the increasing coronavirus positivity rate and cases in these places. India recorded 1,247 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday. Delhi has been recording over 500 COVID-19 cases for the past three days with a positivity rate of over 4%.

324.title: Kindergartener brings tequila to school, gets classmates drunk in US
324.article_body: A kindergartener aged between three and six allegedly brought a tequila-based drink to school in US' Michigan and shared it with friends, who thought it was juice. Several students reported feeling "dizzy" and "woozy" after consuming the alcoholic drink. "I had a small conversation with my daughter...and she told me the girl knew it was liquor," a parent said.

325.title: There's no ideal body type in entertainment industry: Palak Tiwari
325.article_body: Palak Tiwari said there's no ideal body type in the entertainment industry. "We live in India, an ideal body type is a size medium but people fat shame...size medium. When you are too skinny, they have an issue," she stated. "It's..same toxic circle of people never being happy...don't think it makes any sense paying heed to that," Palak added.

326.title: Need more matches to achieve desired level of tennis: Djokovic
326.article_body: Ahead of Serbia Open second round, Novak Djokovic said he needs more matches to achieve desired level of tennis after exiting early in two tournaments he has played in 2022 season thus far. The world number one added that French Open is his "biggest goal" on clay and he hopes to play more matches in Belgrade than in Monte Carlo.

327.title: LV Vaidyanathan, who joined P&G as an intern, appointed India CEO
327.article_body: Consumer goods company Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced that it has appointed LV Vaidyanathan as the CEO for its operations in India. Vaidyanathan is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad and had joined P&G as an intern in 1995. The 49-year-old is currently leading the P&G business in Indonesia. Vaidyanathan succeeds Madhusudan Gopalan, who'll move to a global role.

328.title: 2 men sentenced to 14 yrs in jail for trafficking minors in Jaipur
328.article_body: A special court in Jaipur on Tuesday sentenced two men to 14 years in jail for trafficking minors and forcing them into child labour. The accused had trafficked at least 33 children from Bihar, who were rescued during a police raid in the city in 2018. A fine of ₹5.64 lakh has also been imposed on each of the accused.

329.title: 'Beta apne ghar par dhyan do': Suniel to troll over his remark after KL Rahul's hundred
329.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty responded to a troll's remark after LSG captain KL Rahul smashed a hundred in his 100th IPL match against MI on Saturday. Suniel had shared an appreciation post, on which the troll commented how in the absence of Suniel and his family, KL Rahul was able to score a century. "Focus on your own home," Suniel replied.

330.title: European Commission Prez to arrive on 2-day visit to India from Apr 24
330.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will arrive on a two-day visit to India from April 24, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. She is scheduled to meet President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi during her first official visit.  She has been invited as the Chief Guest for this year's Raisina Dialogue, the MEA added.

331.title: Leopard that killed an 8-yr-old boy shot dead in U'khand's Tehri
331.article_body: A leopard, which killed an eight-year-old boy in Uttarakhand's Tehri district, was shot dead after it "returned to its kill site to devour the remaining body on Monday", a forest officer said. The boy was attacked while walking to a village to attend a wedding ceremony. Officials believe the leopard attacked humans as its damaged nails prevented it from hunting.

332.title: Heatwave pushes Delhi's power demand to 5,735 MW, highest ever in April
332.article_body: The peak power demand in Delhi on Tuesday rose to 5,735 MW, which is the highest ever in the month of April, after unabated heatwave in the city, discom officials said. Delhi's peak power demand had touched 4,469 MW on April 1. The national capital's previous high power demand was recorded at 5,664 MW on April 30, 2019, officials added.

333.title: Which are the world's most affordable and least affordable cities to buy home?
333.article_body: The US city of Pittsburgh is the most affordable city for buying a house, according to the Demographia International Housing Affordability's study on housing prices for 92 major markets (metropolitan areas). It's followed by Oklahoma City and Rochester in the US, Edmonton in Canada and St. Louis in the US. Hong Kong emerged as the least affordable city for housing.

334.title: 76 Ukrainan prisoners of war freed in swap with Russia: Deputy PM
334.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that Russia handed over 60 soldiers, including 10 officers, and 16 civilians to Ukraine in an exchange for prisoners of war. "This was the fifth exchange of prisoners of war," she added. Separately, Russia began its offensive in eastern Ukraine after pulling its forces from the country's north.

335.title: New Zealand imposes new sanctions on Russian financial institutions
335.article_body: New Zealand Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on Tuesday said the country is imposing new sanctions on Russian financial institutions such as eight of its largest banks over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Mahuta said New Zealand is imposing sanctions on "18 financial entities, including Russia's central bank, sovereign wealth fund and the largest financial institutions in the country".

336.title: India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030: FM
336.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030. Describing the Indian economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic as "distinct" and "pronounced", Sitharaman said India undertook various structural reforms both before and after the pandemic. India converted the pandemic into an opportunity to further push these reforms, she added.

337.title: Japan's health ministry approves Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine
337.article_body: Japan's health ministry on Tuesday approved Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine as the fourth foreign-developed vaccine for use in the country. The ministry's experts panel endorsed the protein-based vaccine a day earlier. The Japanese government has agreed to purchase 150 million doses of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine which is expected to be available for use by late May.

338.title: Germany probing displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine
338.article_body: Police across several states in Germany on Monday reportedly opened over 140 investigations into public displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. Most investigations are looking into the use of the symbol 'Z' which has been associated with the invasion after being seen on many of the vehicles used by Russian troops in Ukraine.

339.title: Coach Toni Nadal doesn't want me to play like nephew Rafael: Auger-Aliassime
339.article_body: World number nine Felix Auger-Aliassime said his coach Toni Nadal, Rafael Nadal's uncle and former coach, isn't trying to make him play like his nephew. "We've been together for more than a year now working...things are going good...he (Toni) adapted to the player he's working with," he added. Auger-Aliassime will face Carlos Taberner in Barcelona Open second round on Wednesday.

340.title: Ajay Devgn & Tabu-starrer 'Bholaa' to release on March 30, 2023
340.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Ajay Devgn has announced that his upcoming film 'Bholaa' will release on March 30, 2023. The action-drama film is an official Hindi remake of the 2019 Tamil film 'Kaithi'. The film will also feature Tabu and will be directed by Dharmendra Sharma. Ajay Devgn Ffilms, T-Series Films, Reliance Entertainment and Dream Warrior Pictures will produce 'Bholaa'.

341.title: Former Congress councillor shot at in a local market in Punjab
341.article_body: A former municipal council member belonging to the Congress was shot at by unidentified assailants at a local market in Punjab's Ferozepur on Tuesday. According to the police, Congress leader Mulakh Raj was at the local market with his wife when some men arrived there in an SUV and fired at him before escaping.

342.title: Losing 'iconic' Monaco Grand Prix would be a 'shocker': Pierre Gasly
342.article_body: AlphaTauri's Pierre Gasly said losing the "iconic" Monaco Grand Prix would be a "shocker". "I think, and I really hope, we get to experience it as drivers because it's probably the toughest track of the season, the most challenging, and is my favourite one," Gasly said. The Monaco circuit has been a permanent fixture of the F1 calendar since 1955.

343.title: 2 cattle smugglers killed, 4 cops injured in 'militant ambush' in Assam
343.article_body: Two alleged cattle smugglers were killed and four police personnel were injured during a "militant ambush" in Assam's Kokrajhar district on Tuesday, police said. The pair were being taken to Jomduar area for smuggling routes' identification when their vehicle "came under firing from militants", an officer said. Police retaliated and the gunfire exchanges continued for 10-12 minutes, he added.

344.title: I actually wanted to quit tennis: 2019 US Open champion Andreescu
344.article_body: 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu has revealed she "wanted to quit" tennis before taking a break from tennis earlier this year due to mental health concerns. "It was really bad. I'm privileged in a way for having this opportunity...doing all of this," she added. This week's Porsche Tennis Grand Prix is the 21-year-old's first tournament of the 2022 season.

345.title: WHO Centre is starting of traditional medicine era in world: PM Modi
345.article_body: Speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Gujarat's Jamnagar, PM Narendra Modi said the centre has opened the door of age of traditional medicine in the world. PM Modi said, "It's not just an institution's inauguration, it is the beginning of the traditional medicine era in the world for the next 25 years."

346.title: Delhi sees 632 fresh COVID-19 cases, positivity rate drops to 4.42% from 7.72%
346.article_body: Delhi reported 632 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a day after it saw 501 cases. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 4.42% as compared to 7.72% reported on Monday. The city saw zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 1,274.

347.title: Intense solar storm hits Earth, causes radio blackout in parts of Asia & Australia
347.article_body: An intense solar storm hit the Earth over the past weekend and caused radio blackouts in parts of Asia and Australia, US Space Weather Prediction Center said. As per the agency, the solar flare peaked late on Sunday (April 17) at 3.34 GMT (9.04 IST) and lasted around 34 minutes. It was followed by a massive Coronal Mass Ejection (CME).

348.title: No changes made: Google on claims it 'stopped hiding' Russian military facilities
348.article_body: Google has denied claims by many Google Maps users that it has 'stopped hiding' Russia's secret military facilities. Many users shared satellite pics of the facilities saying that they've been 'unblurred', giving anyone a view of the installations and command posts amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We haven't made any blurring changes to our satellite imagery in Russia," said Google.

349.title: Amazon, Reliance, Dream11 & Sony may compete for IPL broadcast rights: Report
349.article_body: Amazon, The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries are among the companies that have signalled an intention to bid for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, Bloomberg reported. Sony, Zee and Dream11 also purchased the bid-related documents from BCCI, it added. BCCI will be conducting the online auction starting June 12.

350.title: Actor Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar, shares pics
350.article_body: Actor Ram Charan on Tuesday visited the Border Security Force (BSF) camp in Amritsar and shared a series of pictures on Instagram. He wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories, sacrifices & dedication of the Border Security Force at the BSF Campus, Khasa Amritsar." In the pictures, Ram can be seen greeting and eating with the soldiers.

351.title: BJP-ruled states should remove loudspeakers from mosques: Ex-VHP chief
351.article_body: Ex-Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia has said that BJP should remove loudspeakers from mosques in those states where it's in power.
