"We had demanded...removal of loudspeakers from mosques in Maharashtra some 10 years ago," he added. Togadia's comments come as Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

352.title: Proud to see Gujarat's success: PM Modi on Vidya Samiksha Kendra
352.article_body: While stressing on how children will be benefited from Gujarat’s Vidya Samiksha Kendra, PM Modi said, “The use of such a huge technology for our government primary school is a wonder for the world. It gives great pride to see the success and development of Gujarat.” He also said it can bring big changes in the field of education.

353.title: I found it cute: Srinidhi on Shehnaaz giving away spoiler of KGF 2
353.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actress Srinidhi Shetty, on being asked about Shehnaaz Gill giving away a major spoiler on Twitter, said she "really really found it quite cute". Srinidhi added she initially didn't believe Shehnaaz spoiled it and thought it was a fan page. Shehnaaz praised Srinidhi's performance, writing, "You deserve the compliments since you took a bullet for Rocky bhai."

354.title: Naxals set fire to 7 vehicles engaged in mining in Chhattisgarh
354.article_body: Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur allegedly burned down seven vehicles involved in sand mining. "There was sand mining going on in the Mingachal river, where six to seven vehicles were set on fire by several Naxals," P Sundarraj, IG Bastar, said. Four Hyva trucks, two JCBs were amongst the seven vehicles engaged in sand mining activities in the area.

355.title: 5 accused in Jahangirpuri violence charged under National Security Act
355.article_body: Five accused in Jahangirpuri violence have been charged under the stringent National Security Act, which allows detention for up to one year without any charge. Clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. Police had said that stones were pelted and several vehicles were set ablaze during the clashes.

356.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as HDFC drops out of the list?
356.article_body: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable company with a market value of ₹17.84 lakh crore, followed by TCS (₹12.71 lakh crore) and HDFC Bank (₹7.44 lakh crore). The list includes Infosys, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, SBI, Adani Green Energy and Bajaj Finance. Bharti Airtel is India's 10th most valuable company after HDFC Ltd dropped out of the list on Tuesday.

357.title: In talks with India to find solution on payments: Russian diplomat
357.article_body: Consul General of Russia in Mumbai AV Surovtsev said Russia is in talks with the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India to find a solution on the payments front. Due to its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been cut off from the international payments system SWIFT. "Complicated situation" created by the sanctions creates room for Indian exports, Surovtsev added.

358.title: Sreenivasan discharged from hospital after cardiac arrest treatment
358.article_body: Malayalam actor Sreenivasan was discharged from Apollo Adlux Hospital in Kerala's Angamaly on Tuesday following bypass surgery as treatment for cardiac arrest. The 66-year-old was admitted to the hospital on March 30 after complaining of chest pain. A medical bulletin issued by the hospital stated that Sreenivasan is stable and showed remarkable improvement in his cardiac and general condition.

359.title: I am closest to Ishan Kishan in MI team: Suryakumar Yadav
359.article_body: On being asked to name his friends in MI, Suryakumar Yadav said he's "closest" to Ishan Kishan. "You've to have him around, whether you've won or lost...he can start up a conversation out of anything," he added. "We don't talk about cricket when we bat together," he further said. Suryakumar and Ishan are bottom-placed MI's top-two run-scorers in IPL 2022.

360.title: Formula One is in a good place commercially: Haas team boss Steiner
360.article_body: Haas team boss Gunther Steiner said Formula One is "in a good place commercially" following the addition of Las Vegas as a race venue from 2023 onwards. "In general, Formula One is in a good place commercially. There are a lot of places that want a race, we can almost choose where we want to go," Steiner said.

361.title: Man arrested for giving pistol to an accused in Jahangirpuri violence
361.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a person named 'Gulli' for allegedly giving a pistol to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case. The police also arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. Drones are being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after the violence, reports said.

362.title: Burning of Sri Lankan man's body by Pak mob anti-Islam: Court
362.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Tuesday said that the lynching of a Sri Lankan man and the burning of his body by a mob was an act against Islam. "The Holy Prophet...forbade Muslims to disgrace the dead body of even a non-Muslim," it added. The court on Monday convicted 89 people in a mass trial over the crime.

363.title: Singapore & New Zealand to jointly tackle climate change: Leaders
363.article_body: Singapore and New Zealand will jointly tackle climate change by cooperating on green technologies, Prime Ministers from both countries, Lee Hsien Loong and Jacinda Ardern, said on Tuesday. The countries will adopt initiatives around energy transition technology, sustainable transport and waste management, Lee added. "We cannot...simply return to a high carbon emissions...approach," Ardern stated.

364.title: Kendrick Lamar announces new album after 5 years, Twitter users react
364.article_body: After a gap of five years, rapper Kendrick Lamar announced on Twitter that his new album 'Mr Morale & the Big Steppers' will release on May 13. He added the link oklama.com containing details of the album to an old tweet that read, "Lamar is officially retired." "IT'S HAPPENING," a Twitter user wrote. His last album 'DAMN' released in 2017.

365.title: Virat Kohli gets out for a golden duck, IPL share video of his reaction
365.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. IPL shared a video of his dismissal. In the video, Kohli can be seen reacting to his dismissal with a dejected smile. It is Kohli's fourth golden duck in IPL.

366.title: Cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme busted in Bengaluru, 4 arrested
366.article_body: The Bengaluru Crime Branch arrested four people for their alleged involvement in running a Helium Crypto Token (HNT) through a mobile application. Around ₹15 crore was routed through 44 different bank accounts among other items, the police said. "₹78 lakh in cash, 44 Digital Signature Certificate tokens, five company seals, mobile phones, and laptops were seized," they added.

367.title: 23 people killed due to severe storms and lightning in Assam
367.article_body: At least 23 people were killed due to severe storms and lightning in separate incidents over the last few days in Assam and the state has promised compensation to the family of the deceased. "In the last three days, 22 districts reported [such] incidents in...over 1,591 villages, impacting [over] one lakh people," an official of state disaster management authority said.

368.title: Delhi Police under pressure from 'secular, Muslim' leaders: VHP
368.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Tuesday accused the Delhi Police of coming under pressure from "secular and Muslim leaders" to book the organisation in connection with the Jahangirpuri clashes. It also said that Delhi Commissioner of Police Rakesh Asthana's statement that it had not taken permission to take out the 'shobha yatra' through the area was "baseless".

369.title: People throw coins in theatre during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening, Raveena shares video
369.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon on Tuesday took to social media to share a clip of people throwing coins in a theatre screening 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "After a long time seeing coins flying on to the screen! #flashingsilver!" she wrote in the caption. "It's a rage...Thank you for the love," Raveena's post further read.

370.title: I've become more expressive after 'Bigg Boss 15': Karan Kundrra
370.article_body: Karan Kundrra, speaking about life after 'Bigg Boss 15', has said that he has become more expressive. Karan added, "A lot has changed...I am not scared of talking because...I have an image." "Everybody thought that I am this arrogant, strict, angry person, like Roadies...Then people realise that he is not," he stated. Karan was the second runner-up in the show.

371.title: Expecting method acting in commercial films is dumb: Nawazuddin
371.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview has stated if you expect to use method acting in commercial films, then you are dumb. He further said that such films are for fun and the audience comes to enjoy. "If you...dissect my performances, maybe you'll find a lot of flaws. But if you take it as pure fun, one would...enjoy," Nawazuddin added.

372.title: Most important 3 points in your life: Klopp on match against Man Utd
372.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said his players must treat the match against Manchester United on Tuesday like "it is the most important three points in your life". Liverpool trail Manchester City by one point in the Premier League with seven games left. "We have to be angry in a good way and all these kind of things," Klopp added.

373.title: BJP using riots as tool to win civic body polls in Delhi: Sanjay Raut
373.article_body: In an apparent reference to Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the BJP has to win elections through riots and do politics. Raut said, "Delhi is UT...The law-and-order is [being] taken care of by the Center...But since the last few days, there've been riots." "[Reason] behind this is the civic body polls," he added.

374.title: War-disabled soldiers must be treated with respect: Ex-VC of Army
374.article_body: Lieutenant General Vijay Oberoi (retd), former Vice-Chief of Army Staff, has demanded better treatment of war-disabled soldiers. He stated that they must be treated "with great respect and should be adequately compensated", otherwise as soldiers take a "conscious decision" to go to war, the future generation will think twice before risking their lives in service of the nation.

375.title: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö tests positive for COVID-19
375.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö has tested positive for COVID-19, his office said in a statement on Tuesday. "Despite the infection, President Niinistö is well and continuing to work remotely," it added. Niinistö's official visit to Norway to discuss the conflict in Ukraine and European security from April 21 to 22 has been postponed.

376.title: Thief dances after robbing hardware store in UP, CCTV footage goes viral
376.article_body: A person robbing a hardware store in UP's Chandauli was caught dancing after committing the crime. CCTV footage of the incident that took place on Friday night has gone viral online. It shows the thief's face covered with a white cloth and he's seen dancing while facing the CCTV camera before escaping through the store's shutter.

377.title: That feels very proud too: Madhavan on being called Vedaant's father
377.article_body: Actor R Madhavan on Tuesday responded to writer Anand Ranganathan's tweet about his upcoming film 'Rocketry' referring to him as Vedaant Madhavan's father. The actor wrote, "Somehow that felt very proud too. Thank you chief." Vedaant won gold medal in the men's 800m freestyle event and silver medal in the 1500m freestyle swimming event at the Danish Open in Copenhagen.

378.title: Punjab women's college management suspended over ₹11 cr funds misuse
378.article_body: The management of Punjab's Akal Degree College for Women has been placed under suspension by the state government over the alleged misuse of funds amounting to ₹11.86 crore. A probe by the state higher education department reportedly found that the managing committee of the Sangrur college had transferred the amount to another college and used it to start self-finance courses.

379.title: 6 killed as SUV and bus collide in UP's Deoria
379.article_body: Six people were killed and 12 were injured after an SUV collided with a bus in Deoria, Uttar Pradesh. The accident took place when the occupants of the SUV were returning from a marriage function, the police said. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed officials to provide proper treatment to the injured.

380.title: TRS leader's son held for kidnaping, raping 20-yr-old after drugging her in T'gana
380.article_body: TRS ward councillor Mohammed Khaja's son Sheik Ghouse Pasha and his friend have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and gang-raping a 20-year-old woman for two days after drugging her in Telangana's Kodad. The woman alleged when she regained consciousness, she escaped and informed her family about the incident. She added she was beaten up so badly that she was unconscious.

381.title: Nani marks 3yrs of National Award-winning 'Jersey', shares deleted scene
381.article_body: Telugu actor Nani on Tuesday celebrated three years since the release of his National Award-winning film 'Jersey' by sharing a deleted scene from the film. The actor wrote, "This was one of (director) Gowtam Tinnanuri's favourite but couldn't make it to the cut." The scene depicts Nani's character being offered money by his wife's father and being called a loser.

382.title: If things are wrong, they shouldn't be sold: Ajay on criticism over endorsements
382.article_body: Ajay Devgn, speaking about criticism over endorsements, said if certain things are so wrong, they shouldn't be sold. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be. Some things are harmful, some aren't," he added. Earlier, Akshay Kumar was criticised for joining Ajay and Shah Rukh Khan in endorsing a pan masala brand.

383.title: Probe ordered against Assam CM Sarma ahead of Guwahati civic polls
383.article_body: Assam State Election Commission has instructed to initiate a probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for alleged model code violations during campaigns for Guwahati civic polls. A complaint was filed by Asom Jatiya Parishad (AJP) president Sanjeev Bora against Sarma, accusing him of promising 'land patta' to landless residents. The complaint further alleged that Sarma sought to bribe wards.

384.title: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast sharply from 9% to 8.2% for FY23
384.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sharply cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 8.2% from 9%, citing Russia-Ukraine war. "Economic damage from the conflict will contribute to a significant slowdown in global growth in 2022 and add to inflation," the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook report. IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.6%.

385.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash, both sides unchanged
385.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are fielding the same playing XIs they fielded in their previous respective matches. LSG are currently third on the points table, while RCB are fourth.

386.title: 1 killed & 10 injured as Sri Lankan police fire at anti-govt protesters
386.article_body: At least one person was killed and around 10 people were injured after police fired at anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka's Rambukkana, reports said on Tuesday. As per reports, police said that protesters had attempted to set fire to a fuel bowser. Sri Lanka has seen widespread protests amid the worst economic crisis the country has seen since independence.

387.title: Dhawan is in form of his life, he's 'Mr IPL' for me: Swann
387.article_body: Calling Shikhar Dhawan "Mr IPL", Graeme Swann said the PBKS opener is in the form of his life. "I love watching every minute of him bat like that," he added. "He's been playing a pink suit gear dog in...[ongoing] IPL," he further said. Shikhar is PBKS' second-highest run-scorer, having scored 205 runs thus far this season in six matches.

388.title: Russia seeks medical equipment from India amid war
388.article_body: Russia is seeking more medical equipment from India after several countries imposed sanctions on Russia after its decision to invade Ukraine, according to Bloomberg. Indian and Russian firms will discuss ways to increase supplies during a meeting on April 22, Rajiv Nath, the Association of Indian Medical Device Industry's coordinator said.

389.title: Main accused in Jahangirpuri violence a BJP leader: AAP MLA Atishi
389.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, is a BJP leader. "It is clear that the BJP is behind the Jahangirpuri riots and it should apologise to the people of Delhi. BJP is a party of hooligans," AAP's Atishi said in a tweet.

390.title: Auditioned for 'X-Factor' as I wanted to marry Harry Styles: Camila
390.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello has revealed she auditioned for reality show 'X-Factor' because she wanted to marry singer Harry Styles. "This is really embarrassing and I can only say this because it's like 10 years ago...I really believed that at the time," she added. Camila further said she thought they'll meet, she'll become a singer and they'll probably fall in love.

391.title: I hate Shang-Chi comics, character is not fleshed out: Simu Liu
391.article_body: Actor Simu Liu has revealed that he hates certain Shang-Chi comics due to the way the stories involving the Chinese-American superhero were written. Simu added that the comics were written by white men who didn't understand an authentic Asian-American experience. "[Shang-Chi in the comics] was very serious, spoke mostly in mystical proverbs and didn't feel fleshed out," the actor said.

392.title: He'll become unplayable bowler, play for India: Gavaskar on SRH pacer Umran
392.article_body: Seeing SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling performance in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the 22-year-old is going to play for India soon. He added that Umran's accuracy has been more impressive than his speed. "If he bowls wicket-to-wicket, he's pretty much going to become an unplayable bowler," he further said. Umran has taken nine wickets from six matches so far.

393.title: HC grants interim relief to Khadse's wife in Pune land scam case
393.article_body: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Eknath Khadse in the Pune land scam case. The next hearing will take place on April 25, Mandakini's advocate Mohan Tekavde said. The case is related to the alleged money laundering pertaining to a land at Bhosari in Pune.

394.title: No one is indispensable: Cong MP Bordoloi on Ripun Bora joining TMC
394.article_body: Congress MP Pradyut Bordoloi reacted to ex-Assam party unit chief Ripun Bora's recent switchover to Trinamool Congress (TMC), terming the move "unfortunate", adding that "nobody is indispensable". Bordoloi added that the Congress "has very strong DNA" in Assam and wasn't dependent on Bora's support. Bora has said that only the TMC is capable of fighting against BJP.

395.title: Once heard an actress' mom say 'Be nice, he's big producer': Poonam
395.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon has revealed she once heard the mother of an actress tell her to be nice to a man because he is a big producer. "You have to be nice to everyone, your driver, make-up artist, producer, director...If a parent pressures the daughter to be 'nice' to a producer, obviously you're asking her to compromise," Poonam added.

396.title: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate jumped 3-fold between April 11-18
396.article_body: The COVID-19 positivity rate in Delhi registered a nearly three-fold rise between April 11 and 18, according to data released by Delhi's health department. While the positivity rate stood at 2.7% on April 11, it jumped to 7.72% on April 18. Last week, Delhi recorded 2,606 COVID-19 positive cases against 67,360 tests with an average positivity rate of 4.79%.

397.title: Kajal Aggarwal and Gautam Kitchlu blessed with a baby boy
397.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu welcomed a baby boy on Tuesday morning, Kajal's sister Nisha Aggarwal told Indian Express. She also shared that both the mother and the baby are doing well and are healthy. Kajal and Gautam got married in October 2020 and Gautam had announced earlier this year that they are set to become parents.

398.title: Pic shows bags full of cats & dogs in China as police kill pets of COVID +ve owners
398.article_body: Pictures and videos of bags full of cats and dogs on a pavement in China's Shanghai amid COVID-19 lockdown are being widely circulated online. Police in the city are allegedly torturing and killing the pets of owners who have tested positive for COVID-19. Earlier, a video showing a health worker beating a pet dog to death also surfaced online.

399.title: I used to be insomniac, now I'm early morning person: Shahid Kapoor
399.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his sleeping habits, said that he wakes up early. Shahid further stated that if he has a shoot at 8-9 am, he wakes up 3.5 hours before it. "I used to be an insomniac. Now I'm a very early morning person...I love morning energy and by 6-6.30 in the evening I am out," Shahid added.

400.title: Mumbai to soon become India's first city to get a 100% digital bus
400.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) on Tuesday released a video on its Twitter handle showing the demo of India's first fully digital bus. For boarding and de-boarding, passengers can either flash their smartcards in front of a machine fixed at the bus' rear entrance or use the 'Chalo' mobile app. The fare will automatically be deducted when de-boarding.

401.title: Boy addicted to games kills self as father fails to recharge internet in MP
401.article_body: A 14-year-old boy allegedly hanged himself from the ceiling fan of his home after his father, who works as a labourer, was unable to recharge his mobile internet in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Police said the man was facing financial problems. The boy was addicted to playing games on the mobile phone, City Superintendent of Police (CSP) Alok Sharma said.

402.title: Bhushan Kumar's attempts show his thirst to get rid of rape case: Mumbai court
402.article_body: A Mumbai magistrate's court said producer Bhushan Kumar, who was accused in a rape case, has "no locus standi to address...court but he has attempted to contest the matter which is...unethical". "His attempts show his...thirst to get rid of the matter," the court said. It rejected police's closure report and directed them to probe the matter as per law.

403.title: Reliance Brands acquires 51% majority stake in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla
403.article_body: Reliance Brands Limited (RBL) has acquired a majority stake in luxury fashion label Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla. RBL has signed a definitive agreement to invest in the prominent couture brand for a 51% stake. The company has recently set up a ready-to-wear fashion venture with Delhi-based designer Rahul Mishra and also acquired a 40% stake in Manish Malhotra.
